enemy_1376_ltndru.Name: Remnant Orchestra Drummer

AbilityList.Text: After 2 attacks, the next attack deals splash damage to all targets in attack range
Attack range increases when passionate variation is active

enemy_1376_ltndru_2.Description: Drummer who once set the beat for their king's music. Every beat he drums is filled with suffering, for he torments himself to achieve impeccable rhythm.
enemy_1376_ltndru_2.Name: Witch King's Orchestra Drummer

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked by your units

When melancholic variation is active, ATK is greatly increased, and gains a Shield that protects against a certain number of attacks; each time damage is prevented, reflects as Physical damage based on own ATK

enemy_1377_ltnclo.Description: Cellist who wants to be their king's trusted henchman. He lives to earn their king's favor, for which he is willing to play obsequious tunes.
enemy_1377_ltnclo.Name: Remnant Orchestra Cellist

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked by your units

When melancholic variation is active, ATK is greatly increased, and gains a Shield that protects against a certain number of attacks; each time damage is prevented, reflects as Physical damage based on own ATK

enemy_1377_ltnclo_2.Description: Cellist who was once their king's trusted henchman. He lives to keep their king's favor, for which he is willing to play loathed tunes.
enemy_1377_ltnclo_2.Name: Witch King's Orchestra Cellist

AbilityList.Text: Continuously casts at the nearest Tuning Node you control within attack range to disable it
When the corresponding variation is in effect, attacks temporarily increase damage taken by your units

enemy_1378_ltnmst.Description: Musician who wants to tune for their king. He seeks the harmony of origin, so that all sounds may be consonant.
enemy_1378_ltnmst.Name: Remnant Orchestra Tuner

AbilityList.Text: Continuously casts at the nearest Tuning Node you control within attack range to disable it
When the corresponding variation is in effect, attacks temporarily increase damage taken by your units

enemy_1378_ltnmst_2.Description: Musician who once tuned for their king. He has touched the harmony of origin, and in his hands all sounds may be consonant.
enemy_1378_ltnmst_2.Name: Witch King's Orchestra Tuner

AbilityList.Text: Continuously casts at the nearest Tuning Node you control within attack range to disable it
When the corresponding variation is in effect, increases the max HP of all enemies within attack range

enemy_1379_ltncdt.Description: Conductor who wants to be the instrument of their king's will. Being a conductor is already a rare honor, but he still seeks to climb that great spire, for which he will go to any length.
enemy_1379_ltncdt.Name: Remnant Orchestra Conductor

AbilityList.Text: Continuously casts at the nearest Tuning Node you control within attack range to disable it
When the corresponding variation is in effect, greatly increases the max HP of all enemies within attack range

enemy_1379_ltncdt_2.Description: Conductor who was once the instrument of their king's will. Having been second only to one, and having gazed upon that elusive spire, he will go to any length to see it again.
enemy_1379_ltncdt_2.Name: Witch King's Orchestra Conductor

enemy_1381_winman.Description: Soldier recruited into the delegation, employing the standard orthodox tactics. They are enjoying the peaceful lull.
enemy_1381_winman.Name: Delegation Recruit

enemy_1381_winman_2.Description: Soldier whose fate is entwined with the delegation, employing hardened and ruthless tactics. They are on guard against potential escalation.
enemy_1381_winman_2.Name: Delegation Veteran

AbilityList.Text: Attacks in <Frigid> areas deal Arts damage; attacks in Emergency Heater range deal Physical damage.

enemy_1382_winbal.Description: New recruits on a special mission, firing warning shots with non-lethal weapons to avoid unnecessary loss of life. Having never seen war with their own eyes, they carry out their mission with expectations of peace.
enemy_1382_winbal.Name: Delegation Assault Recruit

AbilityList.Text: Attacks in <Frigid> areas deal Arts damage; attacks in Emergency Heater range deal Physical damage.

enemy_1382_winbal_2.Description: Veteran on a special mission, firing warning shots with non-lethal weapons to avoid unnecessary loss of life. Having seen death with their own eyes, they respond to orders with the instinctive reactions of war.
enemy_1382_winbal_2.Name: Delegation Assault Veteran

AbilityList.Text: Movement speed is reduced in Emergency Heater range.

enemy_1383_windog.Description: Patrol machine developed for the local environment. Moves faster if it is wound up a few times before battle. Low firepower.
enemy_1383_windog.Name: Clockwork Patroller

AbilityList.Text: Movement speed is reduced in Emergency Heater range.

enemy_1383_windog_2.Description: Patrol machine developed for the local environment. Moves faster if it is wound up a few times before battle. High firepower.
enemy_1383_windog_2.Name: Clockwork Warrior

AbilityList.Text: Remains on standby in <Frigid> areas for a while without attacking.
Immediately revived if its plate is in Emergency Heater range

enemy_1384_winfrz.Description: Mountain burdenbeast buried by a sudden avalanche. Its thick layer of fat will help it survive the worst of it until rescue arrives.
enemy_1384_winfrz.Name: Frozen Mountain Burdenbeast

AbilityList.Text: Remains on standby in <Frigid> areas for a while without attacking.
Immediately revived if its plate is in Emergency Heater range

enemy_1384_winfrz_2.Description: Mountain burdenbeast buried by familiar snowfall. It will rest well in its habitual hibernation until it senses the spring breeze.
enemy_1384_winfrz_2.Name: Slumbering Mountain Burdenbeast

AbilityList.Text: On death, deals Arts damage to all nearby units, inflicting Cold and disabling Emergency Heaters.

enemy_1385_winbom.Description: This weapon was developed for close-range assault in response to the painful experience of trench warfare, but how many would be willing to carry a such a heavy and fragile can on their backs?
enemy_1385_winbom.Name: 'Jet Canister'

AbilityList.Text: On death, deals Arts damage to all nearby units, inflicting Cold and disabling Emergency Heaters.

enemy_1385_winbom_2.Description: After many broken and exploded cans, people came to the realization that this weapon needed someone with a death wish, making trench warfare even more painful.
enemy_1385_winbom_2.Name: 'Boom Canister'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks in <Frigid> areas deal splash damage in a cross; trait is inactive in Emergency Heater range.

enemy_1386_winmag.Description: Elite Arts attackers of the delegation, casting with perfect coordination, but still asked to take it easy.
enemy_1386_winmag.Name: Delegation Caster

AbilityList.Text: Attacks in <Frigid> areas deal splash damage in a cross; trait is inactive in Emergency Heater range.

enemy_1386_winmag_2.Description: Ferocious Arts attackers of the delegation, casting with resonant harmony, but still ordered to take it easy.
enemy_1386_winmag_2.Name: Delegation Caster Commander

AbilityList.Text: DEF and RES gradually increase in <Frigid> areas, and gradually decrease in Emergency Heater range.

enemy_1387_winshd.Description: Determined defenders of the delegation, their shields one with the frozen crystals, forming a wall on the snow that few can penetrate.
enemy_1387_winshd.Name: Delegation Shieldbearer

AbilityList.Text: DEF and RES gradually increase in <Frigid> areas, and gradually decrease in Emergency Heater range.

enemy_1387_winshd_2.Description: Outstanding defenders of the delegation, their form one with heaven and earth, forming an unbreakable wall in the snow.
enemy_1387_winshd_2.Name: Delegation Shieldbearer Captain

AbilityList.Text: Throws a massive snowball, dealing splash damage in a cross
Can only use melee attacks once snowball is thrown

enemy_1388_wingnt.Description: Expert grenadiers of the delegation, able to throw shells as heavy as a hundred kilos. The rest of the delegation knows better than to challenge them to a snowball fight.
enemy_1388_wingnt.Name: 'Catapult'

AbilityList.Text: Throws a massive snowball, dealing splash damage in a cross
Can only use melee attacks once snowball is thrown

enemy_1388_wingnt_2.Description: Elite grenadiers of the delegation, able to throw shells with the same power as city artillery. No one in the delegation is foolish enough to challenge them, so they roam the snow with their carefully crafted balls, waiting for a challenger foolish enough to fall into their trap.
enemy_1388_wingnt_2.Name: 'Mortar'

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Prioritizes targets to the right of a Emergency Heater

enemy_1389_winbab.Description: Centurions are normally tasked with assaulting a fortified position. In the delegation, their main task is to defeat the defenders of the heaters.
enemy_1389_winbab.Name: Delegation Centurion

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Prioritizes targets to the right of a Emergency Heater

enemy_1389_winbab_2.Description: If defeating heater defenders has become the focus of the delegation's training, then it is no surprise that a champion would eventually emerge.
enemy_1389_winbab_2.Name: Delegation Centurion Champion

AbilityList.Text: Causes Blight to the paddy when defeated
Becomes <$ba.invisible>Invisible</> on Blighted tiles

enemy_1390_dhsbr.Description: A fabric construct born from the farmers' fears of a poor harvest. They carry a crop-killing Blight, and pose a great risk to agricultural yields.
enemy_1390_dhsbr.Name: Filth

AbilityList.Text: Causes Blight to the paddy when defeated
Becomes <$ba.invisible>Invisible</> on Blighted tiles

enemy_1390_dhsbr_2.Description: A fabric construct born from the farmers' fears of a failed harvest. They carry a wide range of crop-killing Blights, and pose a tremendous risk to agricultural yields.
enemy_1390_dhsbr_2.Name: Expelled Filth

AbilityList.Text: When on Blighted tiles, attacks deal Arts damage

enemy_1391_dhbow.Description: A fabric construct that contaminates plants, capable of spraying Blight from a distance. Even crops on agricultural plates are at risk.
enemy_1391_dhbow.Name: Consumption

AbilityList.Text: When on Blighted tiles, attacks deal Arts damage

enemy_1391_dhbow_2.Description: A fabric construct that corrodes plants, capable of spraying highly hazardous Blight from a distance. Even well-protected crops on agricultural plates are at risk.
enemy_1391_dhbow_2.Name: Banished Consumption

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
Causes heavy Blight to the paddy when defeated

enemy_1392_dhshld.Description: A large fabric construct that uses its huge mass and thick skin to run rampant across the paddies, detested by farmers.
enemy_1392_dhshld.Name: Scum

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
Causes heavy Blight to the paddy when defeated

enemy_1392_dhshld_2.Description: A gargantuan fabric construct that uses its huge mass and nigh-impenetrable skin to wreak havoc across the paddies, loathed by farmers.
enemy_1392_dhshld_2.Name: Accursed Scum

AbilityList.Text: Absorbs shallow water to attack all allied melee units on the map, dealing splash damage in a cross
When on Blighted tiles, attacks deal additional Arts damage and causes Blight to the paddy

enemy_1393_dhele.Description: A fabric construct that spreads Blight across a wide area. If left unchecked, once fertile farmland will become a hotbed of blight in less than half a day.
enemy_1393_dhele.Name: Blemish

AbilityList.Text: Absorbs shallow water to attack all allied melee units on the map, dealing splash damage in a cross
When on Blighted tiles, attacks deal additional Arts damage and causes Blight to the paddy

enemy_1393_dhele_2.Description: A fabric construct that ruthlessly spreads Blight across a wide area. If left unchecked, once fertile farmland will instantly become a farmer's worst nightmare.
enemy_1393_dhele_2.Name: Renounced Blemish

AbilityList.Text: Rebirth
Regenerates itself on the spot when defeated, continuously absorbing any Blight it is in contact with and increasing DEF based on the amount absorbed; attacks now deal additional Arts damage

enemy_1394_dhzts.Description: Similar to a stockbeast in appearance, seemingly docile at first glance. But unlike other fabric constructs, they become aggressive towards people after absorbing the Blight in the soil and water, so exercise caution.
enemy_1394_dhzts.Name: Miasma

AbilityList.Text: Rebirth
Regenerates itself on the spot when defeated, continuously absorbing any Blight it is in contact with and increasing DEF based on the amount absorbed; attacks now deal additional Arts damage

enemy_1394_dhzts_2.Description: Similar to a stockbeast in appearance, seemingly docile at first glance. But unlike other fabric constructs, they become very aggressive towards people after absorbing the Blight in the soil and water, so exercise the utmost caution.
enemy_1394_dhzts_2.Name: Basal Miasma

AbilityList.Text: Attacks surrounding Throttle Valves
Becomes <$ba.invisible>Invisible</> on Blighted tiles

enemy_1395_dhxts.Description: The fieldmus is the farmer's sworn enemy, as well as a living page from the annals of Terra's agricultural history. They have adapted to modern farming techniques, and even Throttle Valves cannot escape their destructive tendencies.
enemy_1395_dhxts.Name: Fieldmus

AbilityList.Text: Attacks surrounding Throttle Valves
Becomes <$ba.invisible>Invisible</> on Blighted tiles

enemy_1395_dhxts_2.Description: The fieldmus is the farmer's sworn enemy, as well as a living page from the annals of Terra's agricultural history. They have fully adapted to modern farming techniques, and even the most advanced Throttle Valves cannot escape their destructive tendencies.
enemy_1395_dhxts_2.Name: Hard-Snouted Fieldmus

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Sprints upon taking damage, gaining greatly increased Movement Speed for a short time
Deals heavy damage to Throttle Valves it passes over

enemy_1396_dhdts.Description: The more bountiful the harvest, the fatter the fieldmus. When these creatures grow four-packs, even the Tianshis sigh—for they destroy Throttle Valves with frightening efficiency.
enemy_1396_dhdts.Name: Fieldmus Bruiser

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Sprints upon taking damage, gaining greatly increased Movement Speed for a short time
Deals heavy damage to Throttle Valves it passes over

enemy_1396_dhdts_2.Description: The more bountiful the harvest, the fatter the fieldmus. When these creatures grow eight-packs, even the Tianshis rub their aching brows—for they can do away with a Throttle Valve in the blink of an eye.
enemy_1396_dhdts_2.Name: Fieldmus Ravager

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Sprints upon taking damage, gaining greatly increased Movement Speed for a short time
Deals heavy damage to Throttle Valves it passes over
When defeated, grants a deployable unit

enemy_1397_dhtsxt.Description: The thing with fieldmus is that not only do they ruin farm equipment, they also take the loose parts back to their lairs. Who knows, maybe they'll be able to build a nomadic city one day.
enemy_1397_dhtsxt.Name: Fieldmus Flying Thief

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Sprints upon taking damage, gaining greatly increased Movement Speed for a short time
Deals heavy damage to Throttle Valves it passes over
When defeated, grants a deployable unit

enemy_1397_dhtsxt_2.Description: The thing with fieldmus is that not only do they dismantle farm equipment, they also leave no loose parts behind. Who knows, maybe they'll be able to build a nomadic city one day.
enemy_1397_dhtsxt_2.Name: Fieldmus Heistmaster

AbilityList.Text: Starts battle as a friendly unit, monitors the paddy's Blight level
Wakes up when the Blight level in the current paddy exceeds a certain threshold
Gradually loses HP. For every certain percentage of HP lost, releases a certain number of Sky Pole - Yi

enemy_1398_dhdcr.Description: Structural pillar-type comprehensive monitoring-maintenance system on experimental plates, Sky Pole Model Jia. Capable of monitoring soil conditions, water source quality, and pest and Blight status in real time; during emergency situations, can release the corresponding Sky Pole Model Yi.
enemy_1398_dhdcr.Name: Sky Pole - Jia

AbilityList.Text: Starts battle as a friendly unit, monitors the paddy's Blight level
Wakes up when the Blight level in the current paddy exceeds a certain threshold
Gradually loses HP. For every certain percentage of HP lost, releases a certain number of Out of Control Sky Pole - Yi

enemy_1398_dhdcr_2.Description: Structural pillar-type comprehensive monitoring-maintenance system on experimental plates, Sky Pole Model Jia. Originally capable of monitoring soil conditions, water source quality, and pest and Blight status in real time; during emergency situations, can release the corresponding Sky Pole Model Yi. However, it has now gone out of control.
enemy_1398_dhdcr_2.Name: Out of Control Sky Pole - Jia

AbilityList.Text: Latches onto the first unit within range and relentlessly attacks until the target is defeated

enemy_1399_dhtb.Description: UAV-type comprehensive monitoring-maintenance system on experimental plates, Sky Pole Model Yi. Capable of completing tasks within the signal range of Model Jia, such as collecting crop samples, eliminating pests, spraying pesticides, and driving away trespassing beasts.
enemy_1399_dhtb.Name: Sky Pole - Yi

AbilityList.Text: Latches onto the first unit within range and relentlessly attacks until the target is defeated

enemy_1399_dhtb_2.Description: UAV-type comprehensive monitoring-maintenance system on experimental plates, Sky Pole Model Yi. Originally capable of completing tasks within the signal range of Model Jia, such as collecting crop samples, eliminating pests, spraying pesticides, and driving away trespassing beasts. However, it has now gone out of control.
enemy_1399_dhtb_2.Name: Out of Control Sky Pole - Yi

enemy_1401_pogpro.Description: A hound trained by the Bolívar Coalition Army. Perro officers were not too enthused about this being introduced into their tactical considerations.
enemy_1401_pogpro.Name: Coalition Army Hound

enemy_1401_pogpro_2.Description: A hunting hound trained in Columbia and purchased by the Bolívarian Coalition government. The idea was met with some resistance within the army.
enemy_1401_pogpro_2.Name: Coalition Army Hound Pro

AbilityList.Text: Exposes the attacker for 5s when attacked
When Exposed, allied units cannot use barricades to keep themselves out of enemy's sight, and take more damage

enemy_1402_tgshd.Description: An armored scout. The armor they wear is capable of pinpointing the location of attackers.
enemy_1402_tgshd.Name: Armored Scout

AbilityList.Text: Exposes the attacker for 5s when attacked
When Exposed, allied units cannot use barricades to keep themselves out of enemy's sight, and take more damage

enemy_1402_tgshd_2.Description: A heavily-armored scout. The Coalition Army has reinforced the armor, but has no clue how to upgrade the tracing function.
enemy_1402_tgshd_2.Name: Heavy Scout

AbilityList.Text: Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 3 bolts in the target's direction

enemy_1403_gunsho.Description: A light crossbowman who can fire three bolts at once. The price of such on-demand firepower is their weakness in long-time battles.
enemy_1403_gunsho.Name: Light Rapid Crossbowman

AbilityList.Text: Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 3 bolts in the target's direction

enemy_1403_gunsho_2.Description: A heavy crossbowman who can fire three bolts at once. The Columbian investigation team was forced to admit that these 'homemade gadgets' were just as powerful as some of the latest cutting-edge weaponry.
enemy_1403_gunsho_2.Name: Heavy Rapid Crossbowman

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 1 bolt in the target's direction that deals Arts damage and inflicts <$ba.stun>Stun</>

enemy_1404_msnip.Description: A sniper issued with a mass-produced kinetically-boosted crossbow. Though expensive, they are well worth the price tag, capable of stunning targets for long durations after being charged up.
enemy_1404_msnip.Name: Heavy Crossbowman Ambusher

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 1 bolt in the target's direction that deals Arts damage and inflicts <$ba.stun>Stun</>

enemy_1404_msnip_2.Description: A sniper issued with a prototype kinetically-boosted crossbow. Exorbitantly expensive. It's said that the buyer reached a secret agreement with a small Columbian company.
enemy_1404_msnip_2.Name: Heavy Crossbowman Hunter

AbilityList.Text: Upon taking damage for the first time while unblocked, fires an explosive in each cardinal direction; afterwards, gains increased Movement Speed and reduced Weight

enemy_1405_boomer.Description: A specialized combatant who does not carry conventional weapons. Though well-paid and exempted from standard military training, nobody envies them.
enemy_1405_boomer.Name: Reckless Grenadier

AbilityList.Text: Upon taking damage for the first time while unblocked, fires an explosive in each cardinal direction; afterwards, gains increased Movement Speed and reduced Weight

enemy_1405_boomer_2.Description: A specialized combatant whose fighting methods differ from the norm. The other soldiers call them cannon fodder, unaware that they are seen the exact same way by their superiors.
enemy_1405_boomer_2.Name: Impetuous Grenadier

AbilityList.Text: Each time this unit is blocked, the next attack's ATK is greatly increased.

enemy_1406_chghmr.Description: Heavily-armed personnel in charge of advancing the frontline. Typically made up of grumpy old veterans who take out their anger towards their superiors on anything standing in their way.
enemy_1406_chghmr.Name: Battleline Advance Guard

AbilityList.Text: Each time this unit is blocked, the next attack's ATK is greatly increased.

enemy_1406_chghmr_2.Description: Heavily-armored personnel in charge of breaking through enemy lines. They only know how to swing their hammer, whether it's towards a roadblock or a living person.
enemy_1406_chghmr_2.Name: Battleline Breacher

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
When defeated, Exposes nearby allied units for 8s
When Exposed, allied units cannot use barricades to keep themselves out of enemy's sight, and take more damage

enemy_1407_hummbd.Description: An unmanned drone issued by Coalition Army. Though originally designed for reconnaissance, a circuitry issue made it unreliable at this, so an attack module was installed as a last resort.
enemy_1407_hummbd.Name: Farseer

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
When defeated, Exposes nearby allied units for 8s
When Exposed, allied units cannot use barricades to keep themselves out of enemy's sight, and take more damage

enemy_1407_hummbd_2.Description: An unmanned drone modified by a Coalition veteran, who haphazardly adjusted the circuitry of the recon module before devoting the rest of his effort into boosting the firepower.
enemy_1407_hummbd_2.Name: Farseer B

AbilityList.Text: Capable of extremely long ranged-attacks
Shells deal area damage to target and any allied units in the surrounding 8 tiles, and exposes targets for 5s
When Exposed, allied units cannot use barricades to keep themselves out of enemy's sight, and take more damage

enemy_1408_scotcn.Description: A mortarman with keen senses, who fires shells embedded with reconnaissance units. An exceptional talent within the Coalition Army.
enemy_1408_scotcn.Name: Battlefield Observing Mortarman

AbilityList.Text: Capable of extremely long ranged-attacks
Shells deal area damage to target and any allied units in the surrounding 8 tiles, and exposes targets for 5s
When Exposed, allied units cannot use barricades to keep themselves out of enemy's sight, and take more damage

enemy_1408_scotcn_2.Description: A mortarman with a wealth of experience, who fires shells embedded with reconnaissance units. It is said that two military leaders once even fought to claim a senior mortarman.
enemy_1408_scotcn_2.Name: Battlefield Surveying Mortarman

AbilityList.Text: Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 2 explosives in the target's direction
When unblocked, Physical and Arts damage taken is reduced

enemy_1409_bdguad.Description: Mateo's security guard. Every Coalition Army leader needs people like these, or they wouldn't be able to sleep well at night.
enemy_1409_bdguad.Name: Mateo's Security Guard

AbilityList.Text: Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 2 explosives in the target's direction
When unblocked, Physical and Arts damage taken is reduced

enemy_1409_bdguad_2.Description: Mateo's guard. Certain Coalition Army leaders have cultivated such individuals, leading them to feel that they are above their peers.
enemy_1409_bdguad_2.Name: Mateo's Guard

AbilityList.Text: Launches a Straight Shot when positioned in a straight line with an allied unit: fires 2 explosives in the target's direction
When unblocked, Physical and Arts damage taken is reduced
Replenishes all ammo for <Captain Mateo> upon approaching him

enemy_1409_bdguad_3.Description: Mateo's most trusted bodyguard. Very few military leaders have such individuals around them, but they often fail to appreciate how precious such loyalty really is.
enemy_1409_bdguad_3.Name: Mateo's Bodyguard

AbilityList.Text: Capable of evading physical attacks. Loses Physical Dodge against a Stabilizer Chain.

enemy_1410_mmelee.Description: Propelled by compressed air cans beneath their feet, 'Flying Boots' mercenaries raid and plunder on the winds.
enemy_1410_mmelee.Name: 'Flying Boots' Mercenary

AbilityList.Text: Capable of evading physical attacks. Loses Physical Dodge against a Stabilizer Chain.

enemy_1410_mmelee_2.Description: Mercenaries propelled by compressed air cans beneath their feet. Their favorite targets are Ursus convoys and their simple, durable Ursine products.
enemy_1410_mmelee_2.Name: 'Flying Boots' Elite Mercenary

enemy_1411_mmrnge.Description: Mercenaries with a Victorian lens on their helms. Thanks to how well their helms block out sound, they have never heard the snickers of other Scar Market mercs behind their backs.
enemy_1411_mmrnge.Name: 'Pothelm' Marksman

enemy_1411_mmrnge_2.Description: Well-equipped mercenaries with a Victorian lens on their helms. Thanks to how well their helms block out sound, they have never heard the snickers of other Scar Market mercs behind their backs.
enemy_1411_mmrnge_2.Name: 'Pothelm' Arbalest

AbilityList.Text: Temporarily takes flight when blocked or facing a Stabilizer Chain for the first time. DEF is greatly reduced after landing.

enemy_1412_mmjump.Description: Mercenaries fascinated with building new equipment and moving heavier equipment by adding more power.
enemy_1412_mmjump.Name: Scrap Assembler

AbilityList.Text: Temporarily takes flight when blocked or facing a Stabilizer Chain for the first time. DEF is greatly reduced after landing.

enemy_1412_mmjump_2.Description: Inventors who have built a lot of new equipment, but have yet to finish design work on devices for flying and landing.
enemy_1412_mmjump_2.Name: Scrap Inventor

AbilityList.Text: Accelerates when moving. First attack after being blocked deals extra Arts damage based on movement speed.

enemy_1413_mmstck.Description: Bounty hunters skilled in witchcraft, equipped with self-made gear inspired by Kazimierzian knights. They take pleasure in tormenting their targets during missions.
enemy_1413_mmstck.Name: Bounty Hunter 'Knight'

AbilityList.Text: Accelerates when moving. First attack after being blocked deals extra Arts damage based on movement speed.

enemy_1413_mmstck_2.Description: Bounty hunters skilled in witchcraft, aspiring to join the Kazimierzian knight competitions once they've saved enough money. For now, their greatest joy remains tormenting their targets as they hunt them down.
enemy_1413_mmstck_2.Name: Bounty Hunter 'Grand Knight'

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable
Loses a percentage of HP over time against a Stabilizer Chain.

enemy_1414_mmleak.Description: Mercenaries are adept at building makeshift weapons from whatever is available. This massive, sputtering machine shambles forward, brandishing Lateran kitchen utensils while leaking fuel.
enemy_1414_mmleak.Name: Spatula Giant

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable
Loses a percentage of HP over time against a Stabilizer Chain.

enemy_1414_mmleak_2.Description: Mercenaries are adept at building makeshift weapons from whatever is available. This massive, sputtering machine shambles forward, seeking to dice and slice with Lateran kitchen utensils.
enemy_1414_mmleak_2.Name: Enraged Spatula Giant

AbilityList.Text: Will be tripped by a Stabilizer Chain, stunning itself and dealing Physical damage to nearby enemies.

enemy_1415_mmkabi.Description: Large, slow, and docile, these burdenbeasts obediently undergo rigorous training to perform tasks that go against their nature.
enemy_1415_mmkabi.Name: Armored Burdenbeast

AbilityList.Text: Will be tripped by a Stabilizer Chain, stunning itself and dealing Physical damage to nearby enemies.

enemy_1415_mmkabi_2.Description: Slow, docile, and even larger, these burdenbeasts obediently undergo rigorous training to perform tasks that go against their nature.
enemy_1415_mmkabi_2.Name: Greater Armored Burdenbeast

AbilityList.Text: Attacks also deal splash damage to allied units in 4 adjacent tiles.
Cuts Stabilizer Chains.

enemy_1416_mmfarm.Description: Mercenaries wielding sharp blades as their weapons. Prone to injuring both friend and foe, they struggle to find companions.
enemy_1416_mmfarm.Name: 'Shearclaws'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks also deal splash damage to allied units in 4 adjacent tiles.
Cuts Stabilizer Chains.

enemy_1416_mmfarm_2.Description: Mercenaries who expertly wield the latest equipment. Their mastery of the blades is so deep that they can operate a loom with them.
enemy_1416_mmfarm_2.Name: 'Weaver'

AbilityList.Text: Targets one of your units, continuously dealing Arts and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to the target and all Operators connected to that unit by Stabilizer Chains.

enemy_1417_mmdudu.Description: Agitated rhythms and intense rumbling form the melody of the nomadic city of Kazdel. The members of this metal band have transformed their weapons into musical instruments, blending their dual roles as mercenaries and musicians.
enemy_1417_mmdudu.Name: Rogue Mercenary 'Bass'

AbilityList.Text: Targets one of your units, continuously dealing Arts and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to the target and all Operators connected to that unit by Stabilizer Chains.

enemy_1417_mmdudu_2.Description: Metal band members who seamlessly blend their mercenary and performer careers. Their torrential rhythms are powerful enough to melt faces—literally.
enemy_1417_mmdudu_2.Name: Rogue Mercenary 'Lead Guitar'

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Attack range reduced when it loses <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>.

enemy_1418_mmkonm.Description: Sarkaz artificers obsessed with building a flying machine. The patches on the balloon mend not just the vehicle, but the heart of a dreamer as well.
enemy_1418_mmkonm.Name: 'Tinkerer'

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Attack range reduced when it loses <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>.

enemy_1418_mmkonm_2.Description: Sarkaz artificers who have finally invented a working flying machine, perhaps the predecessor to far more powerful war machines in the distant future.
enemy_1418_mmkonm_2.Name: 'Mechanic'

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>; the next attack made after breaking <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</> will deal increased damage.
Has Arts and Physical dodge.
Temporarily loses Invisibility, Physical dodge, and Arts dodge against a Stabilizer Chain.
Can pass through a blocking unit once when HP drops to below 50%.

enemy_1419_mmcike.Description: Sarkaz assassins who have abandoned their names and cut off their horns. Behind their pall is a burning fanaticism and a destined fate.
enemy_1419_mmcike.Name: Deathveil Assassin

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts damage when inside Originium pollution.

enemy_1422_lrsldr.Description: Elites of the Nachzehrer King's armies, adept in Originium-rich environments. They draw power from Originium dust and fight until death claims them as nutrients for their comrades.
enemy_1422_lrsldr.Name: Sarkaz Wither Vanguard

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts damage when inside Originium pollution.

enemy_1422_lrsldr_2.Description: Elite commanders of the Nachzehrer King's armies, adept with extreme Originium-rich environments. Originium dust sharpens their blades as they slaughter their foes, until death comes. With each commander fallen, the legion advances in great strides.
enemy_1422_lrsldr_2.Name: Elite Sarkaz Wither Vanguard

enemy_1423_lrfkkt.Description: Veteran guards of the Nachzehrer King's legions. Martyrs who advance to certain death knowing that others will carry their blood soaked shield.
enemy_1423_lrfkkt.Name: Sarkaz Wither Bulwark

enemy_1423_lrfkkt_2.Description: Elite guards of the Nachzehrer King's legions. The aegis of hatred and war is a role of ultimate protection and sacrifice.
enemy_1423_lrfkkt_2.Name: Sarkaz Wither Aegis

AbilityList.Text: Upon death, deals Physical damage in an area and causes Originium pollution.
Increases the strength of an Active Originium Storm when consumed by it.

enemy_1424_lrboom.Description: Mutated Originium slugs around Londinium, altered by the rapidly changing environment. Filled with dangerous Originium particulates, their bodies explode upon death, spreading active Originium pollution.
enemy_1424_lrboom.Name: Caustic Originium Slug

AbilityList.Text: Upon death, deals Physical damage in an area and causes Originium pollution.
Increases the strength of an Active Originium Storm when consumed by it.

enemy_1424_lrboom_2.Description: Highly mutated Originium slugs around Londinium, altered by the rapidly changing environment. Filled with extremely dangerous Originium particulates, their bodies explode upon death, spreading active Originium pollution.
enemy_1424_lrboom_2.Name: Caustic Originium Slug α

AbilityList.Text: Continuously causes an area of Originium pollution around itself when affected by Originium pollution or an Active Originium Storm, and attacks deal Arts damage instead.

enemy_1425_lrcmra.Description: A twisted creation of the Confessarii, this bio-weapon combines multiple pure Sarkaz bloodlines. Originium dust clings to its body, spreading as it flaps its great wings while moving.
enemy_1425_lrcmra.Name: Profane Chimera

AbilityList.Text: Continuously causes an area of Originium pollution around itself when affected by Originium pollution or an Active Originium Storm, and attacks deal Arts damage instead.

enemy_1425_lrcmra_2.Description: The twisted masterpiece of the Confessarii, this bio-weapon combines multiple pure Sarkaz bloodlines. Originium dust clings to its body, which it spreads along with its endless fury wherever it treads by flapping its great wings.
enemy_1425_lrcmra_2.Name: Sacrilegious Chimera

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable and has reduced movement speed when taking damage.
Picks up nearby Beacons if it is not carrying a Beacon, and drops them on death.

enemy_1426_lrthef.Description: Engineer casters of the Nachzehrer legion. They set their altars on the battlefield, like nails upon a carpet woven from war. Wherever they go, the storm of suffering will soon follow.
enemy_1426_lrthef.Name: Sarkaz Altar Keeper

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable and has reduced movement speed when taking damage.
Picks up nearby Beacons if it is not carrying a Beacon, and drops them on death.

enemy_1426_lrthef_2.Description: Veteran engineer casters of the Nachzehrer legion whose deaths nourish the altars they carry, like leaves upon the barren soil. Their deaths bring forth the promise of suffering.
enemy_1426_lrthef_2.Name: Sarkaz Altar Nourisher

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Physical damage to all surrounding units.
When inside Originium pollution or an Active Originium Storm, attacks deal Physical damage to all surrounding allied units and all your units inside Originium pollution or Active Originium Storms.

enemy_1427_lrnazg.Description: The Sudaram is the shroud of the dead. Once gaunt from hunger, it is now nourished by the power of the Nachzehrer King. For the Nachzehrer, consumption and nourishment—greed and devotion—are just two sides of the same dreaded coin.
enemy_1427_lrnazg.Name: Sudaram

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Physical damage to all surrounding units.
When inside Originium pollution or an Active Originium Storm, attacks deal Physical damage to all surrounding allied units and all your units inside Originium pollution or Active Originium Storms.

enemy_1427_lrnazg_2.Description: The Putrefied Sudaram is the shroud of the fallen. Once bloated from gluttony, it now nourishes its insatiable kin. For the Nachzehrer, consumption and nourishment—greed and devotion—are just two sides of the same dreaded coin.
enemy_1427_lrnazg_2.Name: Putrefied Sudaram

enemy_1428_lrsoul.Description: Soul fragments born of a revenant's will. Innumerable emotions intertwine within—millennia of confused memories converging into a tangible maelstrom.
enemy_1428_lrsoul.Name: Soul Maelstrom

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts damage. Can pick up and retain up to 3 Soul Maelstroms.
When carrying a Soul Maelstrom, expends all Soul Maelstroms to deal continuous Arts damage to the target and all your units in a line.

enemy_1429_lrwzrd.Description: Soul remnant born of a revenant's will. As it absorbs the roving maelstroms, it releases turbulent witchcraft and emotions that impale enemies both in front and behind.
enemy_1429_lrwzrd.Name: Focused Soul Remnant

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts damage. Can pick up and retain up to 3 Soul Maelstroms.
When carrying a Soul Maelstrom, expends all Soul Maelstroms to deal continuous Arts damage to the target and all your units in a line.

enemy_1429_lrwzrd_2.Description: Powerful soul remnant born of a revenant's will. As it absorbs roving maelstroms, it releases violent witchcraft and emotions that impale enemies both in front and behind.
enemy_1429_lrwzrd_2.Name: Prism Soul Remnant

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Shares a fraction of the damage taken by non-aerial enemies around itself.

enemy_1430_lrrook.Description: Soul chalice born of a revenant's will, brimming with regret unfathomable. The past, tormenting yet unchangeable, is the cruelest cut.
enemy_1430_lrrook.Name: Chalice of Regret

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Shares a fraction of the damage taken by non-aerial enemies around itself.

enemy_1430_lrrook_2.Description: Greater soul chalice born of a revenant's will, brimming with conviction immeasurable. The future, unforeseen but destined, is the ultimate verdict.
enemy_1430_lrrook_2.Name: Chalice of Mortality

AbilityList.Text: Can pick up and retain up to 3 Soul Maelstroms.
When carrying a Soul Maelstrom, expends Soul Maelstrom to summon an orbiting soul orb that deals heavy Arts damage to your units that collide into it.

enemy_1431_lrmzrd.Description: Soul husk born of a revenant's will, imbued with the techniques of countless heroes in its memories. The heroes have all but fallen, leaving behind only indistinct silhouettes as memories.
enemy_1431_lrmzrd.Name: Infused Soul Husk

AbilityList.Text: Can pick up and retain up to 3 Soul Maelstroms.
When carrying a Soul Maelstrom, expends Soul Maelstrom to summon an orbiting soul orb that deals heavy Arts damage to your units that collide into it.

enemy_1431_lrmzrd_2.Description: Powerful soul husk born of a revenant's will, imbued with the techniques of countless heroes in its memories. The heroes have all but fallen, but their silhouettes grow clearly through repeated remembrance.
enemy_1431_lrmzrd_2.Name: Penumbral Soul Husk

enemy_1433_dsbasi.Description: A simple Seaborn believed to be responsible for foraging. It requires very little energy for its activities.
enemy_1433_dsbasi.Name: Unicellular Predator

enemy_1433_dsbasi_2.Description: Simple but nourished, this new generation of Seaborn collects nutrients even more efficiently.
enemy_1433_dsbasi_2.Name: Allotropic Predator

AbilityList.Text: Spawns an <@eb.key>Excrescent Carapace</> at its location when defeated.
More likely to be attacked by allied units

enemy_1434_dsshel.Description: A simple Seaborn that accumulates a large amount of chitin to form an excrescent carapace.
enemy_1434_dsshel.Name: Exocellular Depositor

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Prioritizes units on High Ground.
Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.

enemy_1435_dsflys.Description: A Seaborn with a highly developed cytostome, believed to be responsible for transportation. Shoots venomous cilia to protect itself.
enemy_1435_dsflys.Name: Toxocellular Drifter

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Prioritizes units on High Ground.
Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.

enemy_1435_dsflys_2.Description: A Seaborn nourished in the migration process, possessing more energy for evolution or self-protection.
enemy_1435_dsflys_2.Name: Allotropic Drifter

AbilityList.Text: Splits when HP drops below 50% for the first time.

enemy_1436_dsdivi.Description: A Seaborn highly attuned to its environment, believed to be responsible for stockpiling resources. May split at any time when under stress.
enemy_1436_dsdivi.Name: Divicellular Hoarder

AbilityList.Text: Splits when HP drops below 50% for the first time.

enemy_1436_dsdivi_2.Description: A Divicellular Hoarder that has stockpiled excessive nutrients, capable of responding to intense stimuli.
enemy_1436_dsdivi_2.Name: Allotropic Hoarder

AbilityList.Text: On death, randomly releases a <Divicellular Hoarder>, <Unicellular Predator>, or <Exocellular Depositor> with increased Movement Speed.

enemy_1437_dsfull.Description: A complex Seaborn with a variety of organs, believed to be responsible for brood care. Its core is concealed within its body.
enemy_1437_dsfull.Name: Matrocellular Nurse

AbilityList.Text: On death, randomly releases an <Allotropic Hoarder>, <Allotropic Predator>, or <Exocellular Depositor> with increased Movement Speed.

enemy_1437_dsfull_2.Description: A complex Seaborn that has nurtured countless broods. Its specialized organs have developed into esoteric shapes. Its core is concealed even deeper, and the Seaborn it fosters are even more dangerous.
enemy_1437_dsfull_2.Name: Allotropic Nurse

AbilityList.Text: Can devour an <@eb.key>Excrescent Carapace</> to significantly increase its ATK and HP.

enemy_1438_dspred.Description: Highly differentiated Seaborn with specialized tentacles that have proliferated across the ocean. Numbering in the billions, they are believed to shape ocean currents when they wave their tentacles.
enemy_1438_dspred.Name: Multicellular Herald

AbilityList.Text: Can devour an <@eb.key>Excrescent Carapace</> to significantly increase its ATK and HP.

enemy_1438_dspred_2.Description: Seaborn that have grown in nutrient-rich environments. In sufficient numbers, they can influence tidal movements and even trigger tsunamis.
enemy_1438_dspred_2.Name: Allotropic Herald

AbilityList.Text: Becomes Combat-Ready when damaged, significantly increasing Movement Speed and continuously inflicting <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> on nearby units.
Destroys blocking <Excrescent Carapace> at the cost of a percentage of its HP.

enemy_1439_dslntf.Description: A cell originally meant to develop into a specialized organ has mutated into an individual entity capable of metabolizing body waste into neurotoxin. Its role within the Seaborn population remains unclear.
enemy_1439_dslntf.Name: Nucleic Maleficent

AbilityList.Text: Becomes Combat-Ready when damaged, significantly increasing Movement Speed and continuously inflicting <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> on nearby units.
Destroys blocking <Excrescent Carapace> at the cost of a percentage of its HP.

enemy_1439_dslntf_2.Description: Nucleic Maleficents that have survived in harsh environments, developing glands that produce neurotoxin. Extremely rare, and extremely dangerous.
enemy_1439_dslntf_2.Name: Allotropic Maleficent

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts splash damage
Loses splash damage when blocked.

enemy_1440_dselec.Description: Their consciousness is almost gone. Every nerve strand cries out soundlessly: 'Free... pain...'
enemy_1440_dselec.Name: 'The Abandoned'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts splash damage
Loses splash damage when blocked.

enemy_1440_dselec_2.Description: Their consciousness is fully gone. Every cell remembers the command: 'Dominate... ocean...'
enemy_1440_dselec_2.Name: 'The Cursed'

AbilityList.Text: Flees when HP is under 50%! Gains bonus Movement Speed and cannot be blocked for a period of time.

enemy_10001_trslim.Description: An Originium slug raised in captivity. Has a relatively low infection rate and a rather ordinary taste. Its anatomical structure is different from that of wild slugs.
enemy_10001_trslim.Name: Basic Slug

AbilityList.Text: Flees when HP is under 50%! Gains bonus Movement Speed and cannot be blocked for a period of time.

enemy_10001_trslim_2.Description: A free-range Originium slug raised with care, though it still retains a fierce streak. The quality of its meat hasn't improved much either. Requires a complex process to make edible.
enemy_10001_trslim_2.Name: Gourmet Slug

AbilityList.Text: Releases a blinding gleam upon taking damage, <$ba.stun>stunning</> surrounding allies for an extended period before attempting to escape via digging.
Drops <Shiny Berry> if defeated before escaping.

enemy_10002_trtrsl.Description: A creepy-crawly that lives in a mild environment, forming a symbiotic relationship with a particular species of plant. The berries it bears have a complex flavor, and are a rare delicacy.
enemy_10002_trtrsl.Name: Berry Slug

AbilityList.Text: Releases a blinding gleam upon taking damage, <$ba.stun>stunning</> surrounding allies for an extended period before attempting to escape via digging.
Drops <Shiny Berry> if defeated before escaping.

enemy_10002_trtrsl_2.Description: A creepy-crawly that lives in a mild environment. When the ripe fruits dangle from the symbiotic plant atop its back, that's the best time to harvest them.
enemy_10002_trtrsl_2.Name: Fruit Slug

AbilityList.Text: Devours a surrounding unit but requires an extended period to digest on the spot before devouring again.

enemy_10003_trwlpl.Description: A lab-bred insectivorous plant. Due to mutations from a wrong nutrient fluid used by accident, it can now prey on more than just insects.
enemy_10003_trwlpl.Name: Raging Slug Eater

AbilityList.Text: Devours a surrounding unit but requires an extended period to digest on the spot before devouring again.

enemy_10003_trwlpl_2.Description: A biological weapon bred in a lab. Though a plant, it boasts astonishing bite force and digestive capabilities. What's even more terrifying is that they've started to appear in the wild.
enemy_10003_trwlpl_2.Name: Raging Man Eater

AbilityList.Text: When HP is under 50%, will eat the <Shiny Berry> it carries to recover HP.
If not carrying a <Shiny Berry>, will pick up a <Shiny Berry> near it.

enemy_10004_trdiam.Description: A thriving metal crab that's rarely seen. The fruits attached to its body serve as spare energy reserves and can be made into delicious dishes.
enemy_10004_trdiam.Name: Berry Metal Crab

AbilityList.Text: When HP is under 50%, will eat the <Shiny Berry> it carries to recover HP.
If not carrying a <Shiny Berry>, will pick up a <Shiny Berry> near it.

enemy_10004_trdiam_2.Description: An even rarer variant of metal crab. Its body is laden with even more fruits, and their scents have seeped into its steely carapace. Gluttons and gourmands across the land dream of having a taste.
enemy_10004_trdiam_2.Name: Fruit Metal Crab

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking <Berry Slugs> and <Fruit Slugs> that are not fleeing, causing them to Collapse.
Gains bonus Movement Speed when exposed to a berry or fruit slug's gleam.

enemy_10005_trsmsb.Description: A Sami soldier tainted by demonic corruption. It seems all that's left are base instincts.
enemy_10005_trsmsb.Name: Corrupted Soldier

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking <Berry Slugs> and <Fruit Slugs> that are not fleeing, causing them to Collapse.
Gains bonus Movement Speed when exposed to a berry or fruit slug's gleam.

enemy_10005_trsmsb_2.Description: A brave warrior who could not escape the fate of demonic corruption. With all consciousness consumed, not even instincts remain.
enemy_10005_trsmsb_2.Name: Corrupted Warrior

AbilityList.Text: When HP is under 50% for the first time, scatters <Berry Slugs> all around it before gaining bonus Movement Speed.

enemy_10006_trsmgi.Description: A golem formed from dirt bound together by roots, summoned by a shaman. Unfortunately, it has been possessed by a demon. The ribbon tied to its arm warns, 'Do Not Approach'.
enemy_10006_trsmgi.Name: Corrupted Golem

AbilityList.Text: When HP is under 50% for the first time, scatters <Fruit Slugs> all around it before gaining bonus Movement Speed.

enemy_10006_trsmgi_2.Description: A golem summoned by a shaman for battle. Over many years of fighting, it too was possessed. The ribbon tied to its arm warns, 'Extremely Dangerous'.
enemy_10006_trsmgi_2.Name: Warped Golem

AbilityList.Text: Non-Leader enemies passing by this enemy gain bonus ASPD and Movement Speed, and take less Physical and Arts damage.
Really likes <Shiny Berries>.

enemy_10007_trspsb.Description: A carefree Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. An inebriating aroma wafts from it, perhaps due to wine mixed into the ink—a joke from an old friend with a fondness for drink.
enemy_10007_trspsb.Name: 'Ink Brew'

AbilityList.Text: Non-Leader enemies passing by this enemy gain bonus ASPD and Movement Speed, and take less Physical and Arts damage.
Really likes <Shiny Berries>.

enemy_10007_trspsb_2.Description: A carefree Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Its presence influences those nearby to sing heartily or ramble on—surely inspired by an old friend with a fondness for drink.
enemy_10007_trspsb_2.Name: Merry 'Ink Brew'

AbilityList.Text: Shrieks for a while when awakened, continuously causing <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to surrounding allied units.
Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.
Drops <Chest Limb?> upon defeat.

enemy_10008_trbbox.Description: A Sea Terror disguised as a treasure chest. It emits ultrasonic sounds that disrupt the brain waves of anyone who touches it, ensnaring unsuspecting treasure hunters.
enemy_10008_trbbox.Name: Sea Terror Chest

AbilityList.Text: Shrieks for a while when awakened, continuously causing <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to surrounding allied units.
Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.
Drops <Chest Limb?> upon defeat.

enemy_10008_trbbox_2.Description: A Sea Terror disguised as an ornate treasure chest. In addition to emitting ultrasonic sound waves, it has incredibly powerful tentacles, making it all the more difficult for entrapped prey to escape.
enemy_10008_trbbox_2.Name: Sea Monster Chest

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed significantly increases when on Crystal.

enemy_10010_sgnja.Description: Bandits often found in Sargonian cities. Equipped with basic gear, they attack only if necessary.
enemy_10010_sgnja.Name: Street Bandit

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed significantly increases when on Crystal.

enemy_10010_sgnja_2.Description: Bandits that roam many Sargonian cities. They are experienced fighters who have survived many run-ins.
enemy_10010_sgnja_2.Name: Roaming Street Bandit

enemy_10011_sgshot.Description: Hunters often seen in Sargonian towns. Their bows are used for hunting in the wilderness, as well as for 'solving problems.'
enemy_10011_sgshot.Name: Street Hunter

enemy_10011_sgshot_2.Description: Hunters often found roaming between Sargonian cities. Hunters who excel at 'solving problems' naturally find their services in great demand across cities.
enemy_10011_sgshot_2.Name: Roaming Street Hunter

AbilityList.Text: Places Crystal on the first tile without Crystal to significantly increase its Movement Speed.

enemy_10012_sgbtle.Description: A curious jewel construct that was believed to be a water pump. Now it runs around with a gem in its...'hand.'
enemy_10012_sgbtle.Name: Exhibit 237-1

AbilityList.Text: Places Crystal on the first tile without Crystal to significantly increase its Movement Speed.

enemy_10012_sgbtle_2.Description: A curious jewel construct that was believed to be a crane. Now it drags a gem around.
enemy_10012_sgbtle_2.Name: Exhibit 237-2

AbilityList.Text: Drops Crystal on tiles that it passes through.
Upon taking damage, Movement Speed significantly increases for a period of time.

enemy_10013_sgrob.Description: A wheeled jewel construct that was once an immobile exhibit. Now it roams the streets, filled with gems.
enemy_10013_sgrob.Name: Small Bejeweled Wagon

AbilityList.Text: Drops Crystal on tiles that it passes through.
Upon taking damage, Movement Speed significantly increases for a period of time.

enemy_10013_sgrob_2.Description: A wheeled jewel construct that was once an immobile exhibit. Now it dashes through the streets, filled with gems.
enemy_10013_sgrob_2.Name: Large Bejeweled Wagon

AbilityList.Text: Will gradually lose HP over time
Drops Crystals on surrounding tiles upon death.

enemy_10014_sgrich.Description: A jewel construct resembling a cracked vessel carried by a burdenbeast. As it shambles on, its cracks widen and gems spill out, though it seems unfazed.
enemy_10014_sgrich.Name: Small Broken Vessel

AbilityList.Text: Will gradually lose HP over time
Drops Crystals on surrounding tiles upon death.

enemy_10014_sgrich_2.Description: A jewel construct resembling a cracked vessel carried by a burdenbeast. As it moves, its cracks widen and gems shoot out, yet it remains unfazed.
enemy_10014_sgrich_2.Name: Large Broken Vessel

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter
Drops Crystal on tiles it passes over, losing a percentage of HP with each drop.

enemy_10015_sgbird.Description: A jewel construct that can fly. 'The books said it was a toy! Hey, why is it leaking gems?'
enemy_10015_sgbird.Name: 'Gliding Toy'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter
Drops Crystal on tiles it passes over, losing a percentage of HP with each drop.

enemy_10015_sgbird_2.Description: A jewel construct that can fly. 'The books said it was a crown! Who put so many gems on it?'
enemy_10015_sgbird_2.Name: 'Gliding Crown'

AbilityList.Text: Absorbs power from surrounding Crystals to provide Barriers for nearby enemies.

enemy_10016_sggint.Description: A jewel construct with kicks worse than its punches. 'I'm going to kick you.'
enemy_10016_sggint.Name: 'Angry Stampede'

AbilityList.Text: Absorbs power from surrounding Crystals to provide Barriers for nearby enemies.

enemy_10016_sggint_2.Description: A jewel construct with punches that match its kicks. 'I'm going to bless you before I kick you.'
enemy_10016_sggint_2.Name: 'Angry Rampage'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict Arts Damage over a short period (stacks).
ASPD is significantly increased when on Crystal.

enemy_10017_sgass.Description: A jewel construct with hands that glow with radiance. The statue on the left side of the hall now roams the streets, the legacy of ancient Sargon shining bright.
enemy_10017_sgass.Name: Hall Statue (Left)

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict Arts Damage over a short period (stacks).
ASPD is significantly increased when on Crystal.

enemy_10017_sgass_2.Description: A jewel construct with hands that glow with radiance. The statue on the right side of the hall now roams the streets, a testament to the destructive power of ancient technology.
enemy_10017_sgass_2.Name: Hall Statue (Right)

AbilityList.Text: Attacks two targets simultaneously.
Has a short default attack range, but performs extremely long-range attacks when on Crystal.

enemy_10018_sgrobh.Description: A single-wheel jewel construct, believed to be a children's toy when it sat docilely on its stand.
enemy_10018_sgrobh.Name: 'Unicycle Toy'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks two targets simultaneously.
Has a short default attack range, but performs extremely long-range attacks when on Crystal.

enemy_10018_sgrobh_2.Description: A single-wheel jewel construct. Its upper structure once bewildered researchers, but those who have seen its head bounce no longer harbor any doubts.
enemy_10018_sgrobh_2.Name: 'Bouncing Unicycle'

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
Starts with low DEF and RES, but permanently gains DEF when taking Physical damage and RES when taking Arts damage, up to a maximum.

enemy_10019_sgmum.Description: Strange entities sighted amongst the jewel constructs. No one knows which exhibit they came from, but no one can miss the stone slabs that they wield.
enemy_10019_sgmum.Name: 'Bejeweled Slab Defender'

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
Starts with low DEF and RES, but permanently gains DEF when taking Physical damage and RES when taking Arts damage, up to a maximum.

enemy_10019_sgmum_2.Description: Strange entities sighted amongst the jewel constructs. The bejeweled stone slabs that they carry shine brightly in the night streets, like glowing great swords.
enemy_10019_sgmum_2.Name: 'Bejeweled Slab Guardian'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Arts splash damage in a cross.
ATK and HP increase with the number of Crystals on the field, up to a maximum.

enemy_10020_sgcat.Description: Friend? Foe? Mio doesn't care. Mio does what it must.
enemy_10020_sgcat.Name: Mio, the Eager Examinant

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable; can be attacked by enemies
Drops gear in the surrounding area when defeated and <$ba.stun>stuns</> all nearby units; resumes movement after a period of time

enemy_10021_vtcar.Description: The pride of Victoria's industrial automation, vastly improving transport efficiency between factories. Its designers traded defense for speed, trusting in Londinium's peace and stability.
enemy_10021_vtcar.Name: Freight Car

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 1

enemy_10022_vtskny.Description: Citizens who only head into the ruins when no one is around out of a strange sense of honor. They hope to find things in the garbage dumps to tide them over through tough times.
enemy_10022_vtskny.Name: Novice Junkman

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 1

enemy_10022_vtskny_2.Description: Citizens familiar with the art of barter, often found scavenging the ruins. They hope to find things in the garbage dumps to tide them over through tough times.
enemy_10022_vtskny_2.Name: Seasoned Junkman

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 1
After several attacks, charges up before attacking, increasing ATK and stealing gear equipped by Operators

enemy_10023_vtsnky.Description: With factories shutting down and nowhere else to go, young workers started forming gangs. Everyone wears the same goggles needed for work, pretending not to know one another or the people they rob.
enemy_10023_vtsnky.Name: 'Goggles' Gang Thief

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 1
After several attacks, charges up before attacking, increasing ATK and stealing gear equipped by Operators

enemy_10023_vtsnky_2.Description: With factories shutting down and nowhere else to go, young workers started forming gangs. The improvised weapons they use seem somewhat familiar. Maybe from the anti-Sarkaz resistance?
enemy_10023_vtsnky_2.Name: 'Goggles' Gang Thug

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 1
When equipped with gear, DEF increases
After several attacks, charges up for a splash damage attack

enemy_10024_vtstrn.Description: A member of an illegal organization formed by citizens to defend their neighborhood by any means. They often wear fake mustaches to appear seasoned and scare off perps without violence.
enemy_10024_vtstrn.Name: 'Neighborhood Watch' Member

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 1
When equipped with gear, DEF increases
After several attacks, charges up for a splash damage attack

enemy_10024_vtstrn_2.Description: The leader of an illegal organization formed by citizens to defend their neighborhood by any means. Can often be found apologizing at their opponents' homes after a tussle.
enemy_10024_vtstrn_2.Name: 'Neighborhood Watch' Leader

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 3 different types
When approaching other enemies equipped with gear, collects that gear if its type is not already being equipped, up to a max of 3 different types

enemy_10025_vtmstr.Description: A member of one of Londinium's underground insurgent forces and a ruthless mercenary, happy to snatch anything from debtors. No one knows what turned them this way.
enemy_10025_vtmstr.Name: 'Millscar' Mercenary

AbilityList.Text: Can equip gear, max 3 different types
When approaching other enemies equipped with gear, collects that gear if its type is not already being equipped, up to a max of 3 different types

enemy_10025_vtmstr_2.Description: A member of one of Londinium's underground insurgent forces and a seasoned mercenary, happy to snatch anything from debtors. No one who asked what turned them this way has lived to get an answer.
enemy_10025_vtmstr_2.Name: 'Millscar' Elite Mercenary

AbilityList.Text: Attacks hit 3 times
Deals a large amount of Physical damage to all units in a fixed range when defeated and drops random gear

enemy_10026_vtzepl.Description: A general-use aircraft designed by the Industry Development Association for transporting goods. Some members suggest that having a pilot atop might deter ruffians from shooting it down, fearing the risk of murder.
enemy_10026_vtzepl.Name: Transport Vessel

AbilityList.Text: Attacks hit 3 times
Deals a large amount of Physical damage to all units in a fixed range when defeated and drops random gear

enemy_10026_vtzepl_2.Description: An experimental aircraft designed by the Industry Development Association for transporting goods. Other members wish their colleagues wouldn't entrust their dreams of flying to a cargo craft.
enemy_10026_vtzepl_2.Name: Heavy Transport Vessel

AbilityList.Text: Locks onto an allied unit with the current highest HP, dealing Physical damage multiple times to it and the nearby unit with the current highest HP
Can perform long-ranged attacks
After several attacks, charges up for an attack that deals heavy damage 3 times

enemy_10027_vtsk.Description: Royal Guards who swore an oath of eternal loyalty to Victoria. In the King's memories, their steel bodies lined up to form mountains, and white steam covered the sky above.
enemy_10027_vtsk.Name: 'Armor of the Empire'

AbilityList.Text: When equipped by allied Operators
Operators equipped with this gain increased ATK
When equipped by enemies
Units equipped with this gain increased ATK
Obtains a Barrier
Gear is lost when Barrier is broken

enemy_10028_vtswd.Description: Standard-issue weapon components produced by Londinium's factories, not yet sent to the assembly line. Unsafe to hold before assembly, but still more threatening than empty hands.
enemy_10028_vtswd.Name: Unequipped Blade

AbilityList.Text: When equipped by allied Operators
Operators equipped with this gain increased DEF
When equipped by enemies
Units equipped with this take reduced damage from the designated direction
Obtains a Barrier
Gear is lost when Barrier is broken

enemy_10029_vtshld.Description: Standard-issue protective gear components produced by Londinium's factories, only large enough to protect one side of the body. Everyone hopes to nab a piece or two and sew them together before they suffer a serious blow.
enemy_10029_vtshld.Name: Protective Vest

AbilityList.Text: When equipped by allied Operators
For a short time after activating their skills, Operators equipped with this deal additional Arts damage and inflict <$ba.tremble>Frighten</> for a fixed duration when dealing damage
When equipped by enemies
Attacks by units equipped with this deal Arts damage; the first attack after pickup prevents the target from attacking or healing for a period of time
Obtains a Barrier
Gear is lost when Barrier is broken

enemy_10030_vtwand.Description: Standard-issue staff components produced by Londinium's factories, not yet sent to the assembly line. Often malfunctions, but better than letting an Infected cast Arts with their bare hands.
enemy_10030_vtwand.Name: Assault Arts Unit

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10031_cnvsld.Description: An amateur actor participating in Carnevale's street theater competition. No one knows what their day job is.
enemy_10031_cnvsld.Name: Amateur Performer

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10031_cnvsld_2.Description: A professional actor participating in Carnevale's street theater competition. Impersonation and playing pretend have become their daily life.
enemy_10031_cnvsld_2.Name: Professional Performer

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10032_cnvsnp.Description: A merchant selling fireworks during Carnevale. Go ahead, buy some. Lighting fireworks is 100% legal and by the book.
enemy_10032_cnvsnp.Name: Fireworks Merchant

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10032_cnvsnp_2.Description: A dealer selling fireworks during Carnevale. Picking up fireworks and pulling the trigger are all quite familiar to him.
enemy_10032_cnvsnp_2.Name: Fireworks Dealer

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>, normally does not attack, but counters when losing Invisibility
Attacks deal Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</>.
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10033_cnvbsk.Description: An artist who brings fire to the streets, performing a dance from faraway lands. The closer to Carnevale, the more he practices—how to precisely injure a particular target among the crowd, that is.
enemy_10033_cnvbsk.Name: Streetside Fire Juggler

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>, normally does not attack, but counters when losing Invisibility
Attacks deal Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</>.
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10033_cnvbsk_2.Description: An accomplished maestro of the fire dance, who injects Siracusan style into this foreign dance. The closer to Carnevale, the more he plays with fire, and the more accidents he causes.
enemy_10033_cnvbsk_2.Name: Streetside Fire Maestro

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>, normally does not attack, but counters when losing Invisibility
Continuously deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> for the skill duration
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10034_cnvsax.Description: A street musician adorned in holiday garb. He's not great with his instrument, and he's causing a massive racket. Good thing it's Carnevale.
enemy_10034_cnvsax.Name: Festival Jazz Musician

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>, normally does not attack, but counters when losing Invisibility
Continuously deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> for the skill duration
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10034_cnvsax_2.Description: A musician in festive garb who's part of the parade. He's gotten pretty good with his instrument, and he knows when best to get the crowd going.
enemy_10034_cnvsax_2.Name: Parading Jazz Musician

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Continuously deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> for the skill duration, Attack Range increases when Invisibility is lost
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10035_cnvdnc.Description: A solo dancer from a troupe invited by big companies to liven up Carnevale. A tantalizing dance, a dangerous enthusiasm.
enemy_10035_cnvdnc.Name: Entusiasta Dancer

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Continuously deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> for the skill duration, Attack Range increases when Invisibility is lost
Loses Invisibility during Carnevale

enemy_10035_cnvdnc_2.Description: The lead dancer from a troupe invited by big companies to liven up Carnevale. Her skirt flickers like flame, warming the crowd and setting the streets ablaze—literally!
enemy_10035_cnvdnc_2.Name: Entusiasta Lead Dancer

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage; loses damage reduction during Carnevale
Periodically summons a <Carnevale Snack Cart>

enemy_10036_cnvpvd.Description: A snack seller—ubiquitous during Carnevale—pushing a perfectly ordinary cart. However, not all his customers are here for food.
enemy_10036_cnvpvd.Name: Carnevale Snack Seller

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage; loses damage reduction during Carnevale
Periodically summons a <Parade Snack Cart>

enemy_10036_cnvpvd_2.Description: A snack seller—part of a swarm trailing the parade—his cart filled to the brim with treats. However, they're not the only thing in stock.
enemy_10036_cnvpvd_2.Name: Parade Snack Seller

AbilityList.Text: Detonates when blocked, inflicting Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to all nearby targets

enemy_10037_cnvpcar.Description: A small cart, filled with snacks carefully chosen by merchants. They pack a punch and bring the heat.
enemy_10037_cnvpcar.Name: Carnevale Snack Cart

AbilityList.Text: Detonates when blocked, inflicting Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to all nearby targets

enemy_10037_cnvpcar_2.Description: A dangerous cart, filled with rare snacks. Extremely unstable and liable to explode.
enemy_10037_cnvpcar_2.Name: Parade Snack Cart

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block, and deals Physical damage by colliding with player's units
Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage; loses damage reduction during Carnevale

enemy_10038_cnvpiz.Description: A food cart frequented by locals, decorated for Carnevale. It seems there's a new chef today. The food doesn't taste as good, but since the line moves fast, it can be forgiven.
enemy_10038_cnvpiz.Name: 'Convenient Eats'

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block, and deals Physical damage by colliding with player's units
Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage; loses damage reduction during Carnevale

enemy_10038_cnvpiz_2.Description: A food delivery truck plying the streets, busier as Carnevale approaches. The chef looks different today—like someone from a wanted poster. What’s he really delivering?
enemy_10038_cnvpiz_2.Name: 'Gourmet Delivery'

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage; loses damage reduction during Carnevale
After charging for some time, deals Physical damage to a target and all surrounding allied units, and temporarily lowers maximum Block; this attack can weaken flames

enemy_10039_cnvber.Description: A large truck dispensing beer during Carnevale with corporate backing. Brace yourself for the drunken brawls that follow the merriment.
enemy_10039_cnvber.Name: 'Happy Drinking'

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage; loses damage reduction during Carnevale
After charging for some time, deals Physical damage to a target and all surrounding allied units, and temporarily lowers maximum Block; this attack can weaken flames

enemy_10039_cnvber_2.Description: A large truck spraying beer over the masses from within the parade at the behest of corporations. The crowd goes wild, and order slowly collapses. Now it's a real party.
enemy_10039_cnvber_2.Name: 'Merrymaker Express'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter
Restores some HP to 'Firework Launcher' when defeated during Carnevale

enemy_10040_cnvbln.Description: One of the many balloons in the city during Carnevale. Makes a loud bang when pierced—though it's not a gun shot, it can still make the crowd go wild.
enemy_10040_cnvbln.Name: Carnevale Balloon

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter
Restores a large amount of HP to 'Firework Launcher' when defeated during Carnevale

enemy_10040_cnvbln_2.Description: One of the balloons released during the parade. Makes a loud bang when pierced—though it's not a gun, it can still make the crowd go wild.
enemy_10040_cnvbln_2.Name: Parade Balloon

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Builds rope bridges that allow units to cross

enemy_10042_prtrop.Description: Portable and quick to build, rope bridges are a convenient way to connect two salt ships. Bridge builders are responsible for constructing them, but they still need others to help hold them in place and prevent them from falling apart.
enemy_10042_prtrop.Name: Bridge Builder

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Builds rope bridges that allow units to cross

enemy_10042_prtrop_2.Description: Portable and quick to build, rope bridges are a convenient way to connect two salt ships. These experienced bridge holders have steady hands, but have not figured out how to fix the structural defects of the bridge.
enemy_10042_prtrop_2.Name: Bridge Holder

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed increases briefly when crossing a Rope Bridge or launched by a <Saltheap Cannon>

enemy_10043_sailor.Description: Sailing in the Salt Flat is a hazardous affair to begin with, but some sailors seek even greater thrills, such as hanging from a flying fin, or firing themselves from saltheap cannons.
enemy_10043_sailor.Name: Risk-seeking Sailor

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed increases briefly when crossing a Rope Bridge or launched by a <Saltheap Cannon>

enemy_10043_sailor_2.Description: Sailing in the Salt Flat is a hazardous affair to begin with, but some sailors seek even greater thrills, such as hanging from a flying fin, or firing themselves from saltheap cannons. Those who survive tend to go to even more extreme lengths to satisfy their thirst for danger.
enemy_10043_sailor_2.Name: Risk-surviving Sailor

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed increases when carrying a Booze Barrel
First attack consumes Booze Barrel to deal heavy Physical damage and create an area where enemies gain increased ASPD and Physical Dodge

enemy_10044_wintun.Description: Sailors recommend their favorite things to each other, including saltfin garum. Some sailors take it a little too far, however, and roll their barrels into each other's faces.
enemy_10044_wintun.Name: Garum Gourmet

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed increases when carrying a Booze Barrel
First attack consumes Booze Barrel to deal heavy Physical damage and create an area where enemies gain increased ASPD and Physical Dodge

enemy_10044_wintun_2.Description: Sailors recommend their favorite things to each other, including rum. Not that rum needs recommending to begin with—everyone on the crew understands how valuable it is out on the flat, and would love to share it at any time.
enemy_10044_wintun_2.Name: Rum Gourmet

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>; after losing <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>, becomes <$ba.stun>stunned</> for some time before taking off again
Movement Speed briefly increases after taking damage for the first time. Sometimes carries <Risk-seeking Sailor>

enemy_10045_parrot.Description: A female fin that leaps out of the salt layer during breeding season, gliding briefly in mid-air and releasing pleasant pheromones. Having one fall onto the deck is seen as a sign of good luck.
enemy_10045_parrot.Name: Lucky Flyfin

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>; after losing <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>, becomes <$ba.stun>stunned</> for some time before taking off again
Movement Speed briefly increases after taking damage for the first time. Sometimes carries <Risk-surviving Sailor>

enemy_10045_parrot_2.Description: A male fin that leaps out of the salt layer during breeding season, gliding briefly in mid-air and releasing unpleasant pheromones. Having one fall onto the deck is seen as an omen of bad luck.
enemy_10045_parrot_2.Name: Unlucky Flyfin

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Physical splash damage to all nearby allied units
Immune to the effects of Salt Flat and gains increased Movement Speed while in Salt Flat

enemy_10046_pshark.Description: Despite its size and weight, this saltfin is surprisingly lithe when swimming through the salts. Normally gentle in nature, it can shake the salt fields and cause land subsidence with its powerful slamming attacks when provoked.
enemy_10046_pshark.Name: Saltfin Shaker

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal Physical splash damage to all nearby allied units
Immune to the effects of Salt Flat and gains increased Movement Speed while in Salt Flat

enemy_10046_pshark_2.Description: Despite its size and weight, this saltfin is surprisingly lithe when swimming through the salts. Normally gentle in nature, it can shatter even hardened ancient salt layers with its powerful slamming attacks when provoked.
enemy_10046_pshark_2.Name: Saltfin Breaker

AbilityList.Text: Can perform a charged attack, dealing a large amount of Arts Damage to all nearby allied units with a <$ba.stun>Stun</> effect
Can ride <Saltfin Shakers>, gaining some of their abilities

enemy_10047_shrknt.Description: The Saltheap Cannon is driven not by Originium explosives, but by the kinetic power of saltfin sinew. Dissatisfied with this state of affairs, some sailors have taken to stuffing improvised powder into metal tubes, trying to create true explosions.
enemy_10047_shrknt.Name: Explosion Chaser

AbilityList.Text: Can perform a charged attack, dealing a large amount of Arts Damage to all nearby allied units with a <$ba.stun>Stun</> effect
Can ride <Saltfin Breakers>, gaining some of their abilities

enemy_10047_shrknt_2.Description: The Saltheap Cannon is driven not by Originium explosives, but by the kinetic power of saltfin sinew. Dissatisfied with this state of affairs, some sailors have taken to stuffing massive amounts of improvised powder into metal tubes, trying to light up the night sky of the Salt Flat.
enemy_10047_shrknt_2.Name: Explosion Devotee

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
Nearby enemies and <Saltheap Cannons> take far less Physical/Arts damage from sources in the direction of the shield

enemy_10048_prtsld.Description: More butcher than cook, the fleet's chefs are more adept at dismembering carcasses than making the aftermath fit for human consumption. The smell of blood from the kitchen is enough to make even the most hardened sailors lose their appetite.
enemy_10048_prtsld.Name: Bloody Chef

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
Nearby enemies and <Saltheap Cannons> take far less Physical/Arts damage from sources in the direction of the shield
