enemy_10048_prtsld_2.Description: More butcher than cook, the fleet's chefs are more adept at dismembering carcasses than making the aftermath fit for human consumption. No sailor who has seen one dismember a saltfin has the guts to complain about their cooking.
enemy_10048_prtsld_2.Name: Terrible Chef

AbilityList.Text: While on the battlefield, <Risk-seeking Sailor> attacks also inflict <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</>; Periodically summons 2 <Risk-seeking Sailors>
ATK increases when blocked

enemy_10049_pcaptn.Description: Maybe it is the loud winds of the Salt Flat, or maybe the sailors are acting floppy—the boatswain constantly suspects that someone is not listening to his commands. Thus, he has grabbed a cacophonous saltfin to catch the sailors' attention.
enemy_10049_pcaptn.Name: Cacophonous Boatswain

AbilityList.Text: While on the battlefield, <Risk-surviving Sailor> attacks also inflict <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</>; Periodically summons 2 <Risk-surviving Sailors>
ATK increases when blocked

enemy_10049_pcaptn_2.Description: The boatswain's saltfin has caught the sailors' attention, but it does not stop bellowing when the boatswain wants it to. Forced to yell above the saltfin's cacophony, the boatswain has developed a bel canto voice so beautiful that it may impress the salt flat itself.
enemy_10049_pcaptn_2.Name: Bel Canto Boatswain

AbilityList.Text: Spawns 1 <Sapidity> when defeated

enemy_10050_cjmeat.Description: Abomination born from the daily meals of the people. Breakfast is the first meal of the day, and thus should be hearty and plentiful. Drops Sapidity when defeated.
enemy_10050_cjmeat.Name: Breakfast

AbilityList.Text: Spawns 1 <Sapidity> when defeated

enemy_10050_cjmeat_2.Description: Abomination born from the daily meals of the people. Dinner is the last meal of the day, and thus should be refined but light. Drops Sapidity when defeated.
enemy_10050_cjmeat_2.Name: Dinner

AbilityList.Text: Periodically summons 1 <Vapidity>

enemy_10051_cjmag.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a chopsticks holder left to collect dust. The chopsticks are laid aside when food no longer has taste. Too tired to live, and too tired to die. Such laments summon Vapidity.
enemy_10051_cjmag.Name: 'Diet'

AbilityList.Text: Periodically summons 1 <Vapidity>

enemy_10051_cjmag_2.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a chopsticks holder left to collect dust for a century. The chopsticks are laid aside when food no longer has taste. Abhorring life and abhorring death, such loud laments summon Vapidity.
enemy_10051_cjmag_2.Name: 'Fasting'

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked

enemy_10052_cjshld.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a vessel for holding the five grains. The five grains are fundamental to sating hunger, and the vessel that stores them is appropriately solid and heavy.
enemy_10052_cjshld.Name: 'Sated'

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked

enemy_10052_cjshld_2.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a hardened vessel for holding the five grains. The five grains are fundamental to sating hunger, and the vessel that stores them must not only be solid and heavy, but also exceptionally tough.
enemy_10052_cjshld_2.Name: 'Bloated'

AbilityList.Text: Can use long-ranged weapons to attack <Sapidity>

enemy_10053_cjman.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a broken clay pot. The dinner table has always been a place for petty squabbles, and the clay pot is hardly the only thing that gets broken.
enemy_10053_cjman.Name: Expletive

AbilityList.Text: Can use long-ranged weapons to attack <Sapidity>

enemy_10053_cjman_2.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a clay pot that broke someone's skull, itself undamaged. The dinner table has always been a place for squabbles. Tables are flipped and pots are broken, but in the end, everyone might still have to sit back down and eat together.
enemy_10053_cjman_2.Name: Profanity

AbilityList.Text: Continuously inflicts Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to its surroundings
Immune to <$ba.sluggish>Slow</>

enemy_10054_cjhot.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Boil chili and pepper in the pot, and let the aroma drift across town. Do not be too hasty when you tuck in, lest the heat burn your mouth.
enemy_10054_cjhot.Name: Boiling Pot

AbilityList.Text: Continuously inflicts Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to its surroundings
Immune to <$ba.sluggish>Slow</>

enemy_10054_cjhot_2.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Boil chili and pepper in the pot, add some burdenbeast tallow, and let the aroma drift across town. Do not be too hasty when you tuck in, lest the heat burn your mouth.
enemy_10054_cjhot_2.Name: Drifting Aroma

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Can collect up to 4 <Vapidity> or <Sapidity>; when full, moves towards <Derelict Stoves>
When defeated, spawns <Vapidity> equal to amount collected

enemy_10055_cjgost.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Life is always easier when there is spare meat and grain in the kitchen. Those who have known hardship always keep something in stock for a rainy day.
enemy_10055_cjgost.Name: Forethought

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Can collect up to 4 <Vapidity> or <Sapidity>; when full, moves towards <Derelict Stoves>
When defeated, spawns <Vapidity> equal to amount collected

enemy_10055_cjgost_2.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Life is always easier when there is spare meat and grain in the kitchen. Those who have known hardship are not above stealing to keep a stock of food.
enemy_10055_cjgost_2.Name: Sureness

AbilityList.Text: Pulls 1 <Sapidity> within range towards itself, causing it to lose HP proportionate to distance moved when shifted

enemy_10056_cjfish.Description: 'Put that one on my tab!' Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Often appears in drunken squabbles, but it is fragile and disappears easily.
enemy_10056_cjfish.Name: 'Vanity'

AbilityList.Text: Pulls 1 <Sapidity> within range towards itself, causing it to lose HP proportionate to distance moved when shifted

enemy_10056_cjfish_2.Description: A drink reveals one's true nature and inspires deep conversations. Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Often appears in drunken squabbles, but usually disappears once one is sober.
enemy_10056_cjfish_2.Name: 'Humility'

AbilityList.Text: Can appear in the battlefield
Starts on standby
Can collect up to 1 <Vapidity> or <Sapidity>; On collection, activates and becomes aerial, moving towards <Derelict Stove>

enemy_10057_cjstel.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally a common water pot, it was not discarded even after its original purpose had become obsolete, being passed down through the family as a storage pot. Reach inside, and one can often find trinkets thought lost.
enemy_10057_cjstel.Name: Reminiscence

AbilityList.Text: Can appear in the battlefield
Starts on standby
Can collect up to 1 <Vapidity> or <Sapidity>; On collection, activates and becomes aerial, moving towards <Derelict Stove>

enemy_10057_cjstel_2.Description: Abomination born of the influence of a Sui Proxy. Originally an elaborate water pot, it was not discarded even after its original purpose had become obsolete, being passed down through the family as a storage pot. Reach into this unusually deep vessel, and one can often find trinkets thought lost.
enemy_10057_cjstel_2.Name: Remembrance

AbilityList.Text: Spits copper coins to deal heavy damage at long range; Uses only melee attacks when out of coins
Can absorb nearby <Vapidity> or <Sapidity> to regain 1 copper coin

enemy_10058_cjfrog.Description: Abomination born of the people's longing for a better life. Approach it carelessly, and copper coins will come at you in a way that you did not bargain for.
enemy_10058_cjfrog.Name: Wealth

AbilityList.Text: Spits gold coins to deal heavy damage at long range; Uses only melee attacks when out of coins
Can absorb nearby <Vapidity> or <Sapidity> to regain 1 gold coin

enemy_10058_cjfrog_2.Description: Abomination born of the people's longing for a better life. Approach it carelessly, and gold coins will come at you in a way that you did not bargain for.
enemy_10058_cjfrog_2.Name: Prosperity

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable; Moves towards <Stoves> and can be absorbed by them, increasing their SP
Must be damaged 5 times to defeat; Spawns 1 <Vapidity> when defeated
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter; Automatically moves towards <Stoves>

enemy_10059_cjgfod.Description: Spirit born of the meals people cook every day. Everything picked up by the chopsticks—joy or sorrow, mirth or anger—is a slice of life.
enemy_10059_cjgfod.Name: Sapidity

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable; Moves towards <Derelict Stoves> and can be absorbed by them, increasing their SP
Must be damaged 15 times to defeat; Spawns 1 <Sapidity> when defeated
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter; Automatically moves towards <Derelict Stoves>

enemy_10060_cjbfod.Description: Abomination born of the meals people discard. Put down the cup and lay aside the chopsticks. All is meaningless, and the meal on the plate vapid.
enemy_10060_cjbfod.Name: Vapidity

AbilityList.Text: Deals True damage to all enemy units in its path
Cannot be attacked, does not count towards the defeated enemies counter, will not deplete Life Points on leaving the field

enemy_10061_cjglon.Description: Abomination born of a convergence of Sapidity. Likes to hover over places where many gather, an auspicious symbol that drives out illness and keeps disaster away.
enemy_10061_cjglon.Name: 'Sapid Auspice'

AbilityList.Text: Deals True damage to all allied units in its path
Cannot be attacked, does not count towards the defeated enemies counter, will not deplete Life Points on leaving the field

enemy_10062_cjblon.Description: Abomination born of a convergence of Vapidity. Likes to hover over places that are barren and broken, a symbol of misfortune.
enemy_10062_cjblon.Name: 'Vapid Blight'

AbilityList.Text: Absorbs all nearby <Vapidity> and <Sapidity>
Disappears when <Mouth of Creation> disappears
Teleports <Vapidity> and <Sapidity> absorbed by <Mouth of Annihilation> towards itself
Disappears when <Mouth of Annihilation> disappears
Their true nature is revealed when inside the attack range of your units

enemy_10064_ftyzss.Description: Withered stump possessed by a fae spirit. Not yet able to protect others, it roams only to protect its own dwelling. Reveals its true form when approached.
enemy_10064_ftyzss.Name: Patrolling Foliage

AbilityList.Text: Their true nature is revealed when inside the attack range of your units

enemy_10064_ftyzss_2.Description: Withered stump that has merged with a fae spirit. Serving as a guard for the Dark Woods, it is armed and always vigilant. Reveals its true form when approached.
enemy_10064_ftyzss_2.Name: Patrolling Witherbush

AbilityList.Text: Can be ignited by <Burning Vine> or <Burning Wick>
When defeated while ignited, deals a large amount of Arts damage to surrounding units

enemy_10065_ftzlc.Description: A small, common fae, the original form of Patrolling Foliage. Completely harmless if separated from fire.
enemy_10065_ftzlc.Name: Cabbage Seedling

AbilityList.Text: Can be ignited by <Burning Vine> or <Burning Wick>
When defeated while ignited, deals a large amount of Arts damage to surrounding units

enemy_10065_ftzlc_2.Description: A small, seemingly harmless fae. They would have inhabited vegetable gardens, were they not so easily ignited.
enemy_10065_ftzlc_2.Name: Cabbage Weed

AbilityList.Text: Grows when outside your units' Attack Range, increasing its ATK and Max HP

enemy_10066_ftxjl.Description: Fae disguising itself as a fowlbeast nest. When the fowlbeasts flew away, the spirits in the darkness took it over while it was still warm.
enemy_10066_ftxjl.Name: 'Nest'

AbilityList.Text: Grows when outside your units' Attack Range, increasing its ATK and Max HP

enemy_10066_ftxjl_2.Description: Fae disguising itself as a fowlbeast nest. A cradle, just the right temperature... and 'hatchlings' breaking from their shells?
enemy_10066_ftxjl_2.Name: 'Cradle'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</>
ATK continuously increases before its first attack, and the first attack deals a large amount of Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to the target and surrounding units

enemy_10067_ftsjc.Description: Passionate fae, the fire in its heart like a torch under a strange arch. The flowers and vines wrapping around it are merely decorative.
enemy_10067_ftsjc.Name: Burning Vine

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</>
ATK continuously increases before its first attack, and the first attack deals a large amount of Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</> to the target and surrounding units

enemy_10067_ftsjc_2.Description: Very passionate fae, burning with a even greater desire to consume all uninvited visitors, or consume itself until the last spark becomes a dim ember.
enemy_10067_ftsjc_2.Name: Burning Wick

AbilityList.Text: Takes root and becomes <Thicket> when on a <Meadow>

enemy_10068_ftxsr.Description: Mischievous fae that leads travelers astray. Not that they do it out of any particular malice—going the wrong way happens all the time outside the Dark Woods too.
enemy_10068_ftxsr.Name: Guiding Sprout

AbilityList.Text: Takes root and becomes <Thicket> when on a <Meadow>

enemy_10068_ftxsr_2.Description: Bored fae that leads travelers on a path without end. This job has become so familiar to them that it has become mundane.
enemy_10068_ftxsr_2.Name: Guiding Shrub

AbilityList.Text: Appears when your Operators are deployed in the 4 adjacent tiles around <Shield and Wall>

enemy_10069_ftlsj.Description: Stubborn fae that took root, gazing upon the days and nights of travelers straying into the Dark Woods with no way of escape.
enemy_10069_ftlsj.Name: Tree Shield

AbilityList.Text: Appears when your Operators are deployed in the 4 adjacent tiles around <Shield and Wall>

enemy_10069_ftlsj_2.Description: A silent fae. The path of life is closed. The path of death is closed. All paths are closed.
enemy_10069_ftlsj_2.Name: Tree Wall

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked, and attacks 2 enemies simultaneously
Their true nature is revealed when inside the attack range of your units

enemy_10070_ftkbtt.Description: Ember awakened by the Dark Woods. Born in a gust of wind and given a terrible visage by the fae murmurs, it uses its appearance to protect this forest that has accepted it.
enemy_10070_ftkbtt.Name: Ash Creation

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked, and attacks 2 enemies simultaneously
Their true nature is revealed when inside the attack range of your units

enemy_10070_ftkbtt_2.Description: Ember awakened by the Dark Woods. Born in a great fire and shaped by the fae, it has taken many forms—big or small, strong or feeble. Yet its malleability comes only from nature, never nurture.
enemy_10070_ftkbtt_2.Name: Ash Artwork

AbilityList.Text: Camouflages itself as an <Incursion Point> when outside your units' Attack Range

enemy_10071_ftprg.Description: A fae still learning how to trick people. It disguises itself as the end of the path, or the shape of a cunning tuskbeast. However, it usually misses some crucial detail.
enemy_10071_ftprg.Name: 'End Point'

AbilityList.Text: Camouflages itself as an <Incursion Point> when outside your units' Attack Range

enemy_10071_ftprg_2.Description: A fae adept at tricking people. It appears in the middle of the road or a wrong turn, coaxing people onto the wrong path. The lack of certain details does not compromise the deception.
enemy_10071_ftprg_2.Name: 'Middle Point'

enemy_10072_mpprhd.Description: 'We've confirmed that PRTS has initiated an emergency reset triggered by unknown interference. We're also detecting a dangerous, unidentified instruction looping within the system. Look, see that mark that's been here all this time? ...What do you mean you can't see it?'
enemy_10072_mpprhd.Name: Intrusive Call

enemy_10073_mpcar.Description: Maintenance Helper whose pathfinding module has been disrupted by Originium. The meal delivery function added by the Engineering Department no longer works. 'You want a repair function? Look, we've already got plenty of engineers. As for Warfarin's food safety warning, we're working on it.'
enemy_10073_mpcar.Name: Confused Maintenance Helper

enemy_10073_mpcar_2.Description: Maintenance Helper whose IFF module has been disrupted by Originium. The drill carefully added by the Engineering Department with a safety clutch is now much more dangerous. 'Power output? Look, our priorities are providing our operators with a safe working environment and sufficient moral support, not making this thing do complex work.'
enemy_10073_mpcar_2.Name: Rampaging Maintenance Helper

enemy_10074_mpcata.Description: Cold drink machine that has had its trajectory computing module disrupted by Originium. It uncontrollably launches frozen beverage cans at operators who aren't even thirsty at all. Prize winner of the Engineering Department's 10th Ignoble Prize awards. No one can refuse a thoughtful fridge that automatically launches refreshing drinks at you while you work, after all. Just don't think too much about what the medics would say at your next checkup.
enemy_10074_mpcata.Name: Cold Drink Machine

enemy_10074_mpcata_2.Description: Hot drink machine that has had its temperature control module disrupted by Originium. The super-heated drinks it delivers bring physical and psychological trauma. Prize winner of the Engineering Department's 10th Ignoble Prize awards, though it will not be long before the complaints overflow the department's inbox.
enemy_10074_mpcata_2.Name: Hot Drink Machine

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Self-destructs immediately when there is an Operator nearby, dealing a large amount of Arts damage to surrounding units

enemy_10075_mpwrj.Description: It will brave the chaos and deliver the goods safely to their destination, even when all hell is breaking loose on Rhodes Island. Whether the goods themselves are dangerous is none of its concern.
enemy_10075_mpwrj.Name: Worry-Free Cargo Helper

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Self-destructs immediately when there is an Operator nearby, dealing a large amount of Arts damage to surrounding units

enemy_10075_mpwrj_2.Description: It will brave the chaos and deliver the goods safely to their destination, even when all hell is breaking loose on Rhodes Island. Designed to transport dangerous cargo to begin with, it certainly could not care less whether they are dangerous.
enemy_10075_mpwrj_2.Name: Blast-Proof Cargo Helper

AbilityList.Text: When defeated, the tile underneath becomes unavailable for deployment

enemy_10076_mpgrou.Description: Originating from an archived enemy who was once a staunch defender of hearth and home. Originium has recorded and recreated her last waking moment before collapse. She suspects this place of being yet another illusion of the curse, and of her future fate.
enemy_10076_mpgrou.Name: 'Frozen Monstrosity's Echo'

AbilityList.Text: When defeated, the tile underneath becomes unavailable for deployment

enemy_10076_mpgrou_2.Description: Originating from an archived enemy who was once a staunch defender of hearth and home. Originium has recorded and recreated her last waking moment before collapse. 'Espy the realm, every life seen; seek your sojourn path.'
enemy_10076_mpgrou_2.Name: 'Shadow in the Snow'

AbilityList.Text: Periodically summons 1 <Confused Maintenance Helper>

enemy_10077_mpbarr.Description: Cafeteria meal distributor that is still in beta testing. A busy operator had the bright idea to attach a maintenance helper to it—to save the effort of walking from the dorms to the cafeteria—but the timing of the test was unfortunate to say the least.
enemy_10077_mpbarr.Name: Mockup Auto Meal Distributor

AbilityList.Text: Periodically summons 1 <Rampaging Maintenance Helper>

enemy_10077_mpbarr_2.Description: Prototype of a cafeteria meal distributor. A busy operator had the bright idea to attach a maintenance helper to it—to save the effort of walking from the dorms to the cafeteria—but the design was overzealous and caused even more trouble.
enemy_10077_mpbarr_2.Name: Prototype Auto Meal Distributor

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal splash damage

enemy_10078_mprein.Description: Originating from an archived enemy—an experimental colossus created by spire casters, prone to getting lost. It has appeared in Rhodes Island in a form recreated by solidified Originium.
enemy_10078_mprein.Name: Solidified Originium Colossus

AbilityList.Text: Attacks deal splash damage

enemy_10078_mprein_2.Description: Originating from an archived enemy—an experimental colossus created by spire casters, prone to getting lost. It has appeared in Rhodes Island in a form recreated by dangerous active Originium.
enemy_10078_mprein_2.Name: Active Originium Colossus

AbilityList.Text: Temporarily halts your DP regeneration shortly after it enters the battlefield

enemy_10079_mpmage.Description: Originating from an archived enemy. The Originium body of these Sarkaz casters has induced unknown changes to the Arts they use, which may pressure our defenses.
enemy_10079_mpmage.Name: Stable Sarkaz Caster Crystal

AbilityList.Text: Temporarily halts your DP regeneration shortly after it enters the battlefield

enemy_10079_mpmage_2.Description: Originating from an archived enemy. The Originium body of these Sarkaz casters allows them to use previously unknown forms of Arts to interfere with our deployment, significantly pressuring our defenses.
enemy_10079_mpmage_2.Name: Active Sarkaz Caster Crystal

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Shortly after it enters the battle, throws a bomb to temporarily disable the Operator with the highest DP cost in your Deployment Waiting Zone

enemy_10080_mpiced.Description: Originating from an archived enemy. It seems unremarkable, but is able to strike before our operators take action. The mechanism by which it does so is unknown.
enemy_10080_mpiced.Name: Static Oneiros α

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Shortly after it enters the battle, throws a bomb to temporarily disable the Operator with the highest DP cost in your Deployment Waiting Zone

enemy_10080_mpiced_2.Description: Originating from an archived enemy. It seems unremarkable, but is able to strike before our operators take action. The mechanism by which it does so is associated with Originium.
enemy_10080_mpiced_2.Name: Static Oneiros β

AbilityList.Text: Does not initially attack; transforms into different forms when certain conditions are met
Transforms into different forms once it has taken 4 Physical attacks, 4 Arts attacks, or if it is blocked

enemy_10081_mpplai.Description: Unknown entity born in the Abyss. It is passive if not attacked, but appears to be studying our movements.
enemy_10081_mpplai.Name: Decode Basis α

AbilityList.Text: Does not initially attack; transforms into different forms when certain conditions are met
Transforms into different forms once it has taken 4 Physical attacks, 4 Arts attacks, or if it is blocked

enemy_10081_mpplai_2.Description: Unknown entity born in the Abyss. It is passive if not attacked, but appears to be nullifying our attacks.
enemy_10081_mpplai_2.Name: Decode Basis β

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time

enemy_10083_hlbird.Description: Haloed fowlbeast that the Law has determined to be Sankta. They have not yet gotten used to the 'sun' being so close to their heads, so they scatter and flutter in an attempt to shake it off.
enemy_10083_hlbird.Name: 'Wings of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time

enemy_10083_hlbird_2.Description: Haloed fowlbeast that the Law has determined to be Sankta. They have learned to pray, and gotten used to the 'sun' being so close to their heads. They are the aerial extension of faith.
enemy_10083_hlbird_2.Name: 'Flight of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time
Attempts to steal 1 Ammo from the target when attacking, and deals heavy Physical damage if attempt is unsuccessful

enemy_10084_hlegle.Description: Mutated haloed fowlbeast that the Law has determined to be Sankta. They spend most of their time perched atop the Basilica in bewilderment, unsure which way to look.
enemy_10084_hlegle.Name: 'Eyes of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time
Attempts to steal 1 Ammo from the target when attacking, and deals heavy Physical damage if attempt is unsuccessful

enemy_10084_hlegle_2.Description: Mutated haloed fowlbeast that the Law has determined to be Sankta. They have learned to pray and circle above the streets and alleys of the Holy City. They are the Holy City's perception of itself.
enemy_10084_hlegle_2.Name: 'Witness of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time
[Invitation to Prayer] Temporarily reduces all your units' ASPD

enemy_10085_hllevi.Description: Haloed aquatic creature that the Law has determined to be Sankta. They love desserts, and the way they slap their bellies after a full meal looks like they are praying.
enemy_10085_hllevi.Name: 'Flippers of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time
[Invitation to Prayer] Temporarily reduces all your units' ASPD

enemy_10085_hllevi_2.Description: Haloed aquatic creature that the Law has determined to be Sankta. They have learned to pray, and they invite the slothful to pray with them. They will not take 'no' for an answer.
enemy_10085_hllevi_2.Name: 'Pride of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time

enemy_10086_hltigr.Description: Haloed terrestrial creature that the Law has determined to be Sankta. Empathy has taught these mute creatures the existence of faith, but they do not yet understand it, and often stand still on the street like statues.
enemy_10086_hltigr.Name: 'Claws of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Gains <$ba.fear>Fear</> for several seconds when its HP drops below 50% for the first time

enemy_10086_hltigr_2.Description: Haloed terrestrial creature that the Law has determined to be Sankta. Empathy has taught these mute creatures the existence of faith. They have learned to pray and they want to know more. They can often be spotted chasing after confessionals in the city.
enemy_10086_hltigr_2.Name: 'Crawl of the Sankta'

AbilityList.Text: Expends Ammo to permanently increase Movement Speed and ATK. Ammo capacity: 5

enemy_10087_hlchgr.Description: Selected to patrol the Shrine of Nurtury and ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. Responsible for routine ground patrols. Their combat experience is limited and they are often called upon to clean the shrine's massive milk bottles.
enemy_10087_hlchgr.Name: Shrine Swordsman

AbilityList.Text: Expends Ammo to permanently increase Movement Speed and ATK. Ammo capacity: 7

enemy_10087_hlchgr_2.Description: Selected to patrol the Shrine of Nurtury and ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. Responsible for routine ground patrols. Their combat experience is considerable and they sometimes help instruct animals that have grown halos.
enemy_10087_hlchgr_2.Name: Elite Shrine Swordsman

AbilityList.Text: Performs extremely long-ranged attacks while holding Ammo. Ammo capacity: 1
Stops and reloads if out of Ammo

enemy_10088_hlsnip.Description: Selected to guard key areas of the Shrine of Nurtury and ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. They are still unfamiliar with the sniper rifles in their hands, and often accidentally damage the statues of saints on the streets.
enemy_10088_hlsnip.Name: Shrine Marksman

AbilityList.Text: Performs extremely long-ranged attacks while holding Ammo. Ammo capacity: 1
Stops and reloads if out of Ammo

enemy_10088_hlsnip_2.Description: Selected to guard key areas of the Shrine of Nurtury and ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. They have lightning-fast reflexes and are able to track diving haloed fowlbeasts with their scopes.
enemy_10088_hlsnip_2.Name: Elite Shrine Marksman

AbilityList.Text: Periodically restores HP and reloads 1 ammo for 3 nearby enemies

enemy_10089_hlsprt.Description: Nurturers of the Shrine of Nurtury selected to ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. They are still unfamiliar with their jobs and often lose Enlightened Pacifiers, or mix up the nurseries of newborn humans and animals.
enemy_10089_hlsprt.Name: Shrine Nurturer

AbilityList.Text: Periodically restores HP and reloads 1 ammo for 5 nearby enemies

enemy_10089_hlsprt_2.Description: Nurturers of the Shrine of Nurtury selected to ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. They listen to the hearts of pregnant mothers and comfort newly born infants. They mourn every death and give everything for the newborns of Laterano.
enemy_10089_hlsprt_2.Name: Veteran Shrine Nurturer

AbilityList.Text: Locks onto one of your units, continuously dealing Arts damage; continuously reduces the Wakefulness of units that are dreaming

enemy_10090_hlgrd.Description: Preachers of the Shrine of Nurtury selected to ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. They are firm believers in the Lateran proverb that a good taste for desserts and a full commitment to prayer both start from the cradle.
enemy_10090_hlgrd.Name: Shrine Preacher

AbilityList.Text: Locks onto one of your units, continuously dealing Arts damage; continuously reduces the Wakefulness of units that are dreaming

enemy_10090_hlgrd_2.Description: Preachers of the Shrine of Nurtury selected to ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. In addition to the Nativity, they also know everything there is to know about the Laterano outside the shrine. They ensure that everyone accepts the redefinition of Sankta.
enemy_10090_hlgrd_2.Name: Veteran Shrine Preacher

AbilityList.Text: Enemies within range gain a Barrier proportionate to their Max HP every second (capped)

enemy_10091_hlsttu.Description: A saint's statue near the Shrine of Nurtury, modified to ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. They have taken over some of the roles held by the executors of the Notarial Hall, but they do not read you the tenets before they shoot you.
enemy_10091_hlsttu.Name: Saint Statue

AbilityList.Text: Enemies within range gain a Barrier proportionate to their Max HP every second (capped)

enemy_10091_hlsttu_2.Description: A saint's statue near the Shrine of Nurtury, modified to ensure that the Nativity goes smoothly. 'May the Law and punishment be with you.'
enemy_10091_hlsttu_2.Name: Praying Saint Statue

AbilityList.Text: Attacks 3 enemies simultaneously
Enemies within range gain a Barrier proportionate to their Max HP every second (capped with a higher limit)

enemy_10091_hlsttu_3.Description: The head of the Shrine of Nurtury, the manifestation of the First Saint in the dream. She has bestowed a halo upon a dying arborbeast fledgling, and borne witness to the miracle of life in Laterano. She said this was the revelation from the Law, showing Laterano how to deal with the calamity.
enemy_10091_hlsttu_3.Name: 'Matriarch'

AbilityList.Text: When outside the Filming Area, attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>

enemy_10094_crstf.Description: A temporary crew member recruited from a Wrankwood studio plate. It is his first movie and he is eager to do his job, but he isn't sure why the mic refuses to record.
enemy_10094_crstf.Name: Audio Technician

AbilityList.Text: When outside the Filming Area, attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>

enemy_10094_crstf_2.Description: An experienced crew member who has worked on many films. He knows how to use his boom pole, and thrusts it anywhere he can get sound from.
enemy_10094_crstf_2.Name: Audio Engineer

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by allied units inside the Filming Area

enemy_10095_crgst.Description: An extra holding a clapperboard and pretending to be part of the crew. He started the shooting with his clapperboard in an attempt to get more screen time. He often improvises in front of the camera, trying to catch people's attention.
enemy_10095_crgst.Name: Zealous Extra

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by allied units inside the Filming Area

enemy_10095_crgst_2.Description: An extra holding a clapperboard and pretending to be part of the crew. He is not chasing a dream, just doing it for fun. He likes to hear the audience's screams, caring little about what he is doing in front of the camera.
enemy_10095_crgst_2.Name: Artistic Extra

AbilityList.Text: Places a Lighting Prop on the first empty ground tile within the Filming Area that it passes through

enemy_10096_crprp.Description: The lighting props are too heavy for even this strong Forte prop technician, who has been crushed by the weight of stress and responsibility. He eagerly seeks any opportunity to take a break.
enemy_10096_crprp.Name: Tired Prop Technician

AbilityList.Text: Places a Lighting Prop on the first empty ground tile within the Filming Area that it passes through

enemy_10096_crprp_2.Description: It is not rest but attention that this strong Forte prop technician needs. Everything he does in front of the camera catches people's eyes.
enemy_10096_crprp_2.Name: Attention-Seeking Prop Technician

AbilityList.Text: Takes less Physical/Arts damage from the front
Afraid to face the camera. Turns around if facing the camera in the Filming Area
Inflicts <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> on blocker when blocked

enemy_10097_crshd.Description: A designer who has missed his deadline. He flees when he finds that he has accidentally entered the shot.
enemy_10097_crshd.Name: Uneasy Designer

AbilityList.Text: Takes less Physical/Arts damage from the front
Afraid to face the camera. Turns around if facing the camera in the Filming Area
Inflicts <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> on blocker when blocked

enemy_10097_crshd_2.Description: A designer who always misses his deadlines. He will do whatever it takes to escape attention when he finds that he has accidentally entered the shot.
enemy_10097_crshd_2.Name: Anguished Designer

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.
Attack range increases when inside the Filming Area, and prioritizes <Villain's Minion> and <Destined Villain>
Rebirth

enemy_10098_crhro.Description: The hero's sidekick. His motto is 'Never say die', and he will fight the villains to the bitter end to ensure the hero's final victory.
enemy_10098_crhro.Name: Hero's Sidekick

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.
Attack range increases when inside the Filming Area, and prioritizes <Villain's Minion> and <Destined Villain>
Rebirth

enemy_10098_crhro_2.Description: The hero. His motto is 'Never say die', and he will see it done. His special effects sword decapitates his enemies, and he watches their blood spill on the floor with satisfaction while screams fill the set. He will fight to the bitter end.
enemy_10098_crhro_2.Name: Destined Hero

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.
Attacks hit twice when inside the Filming Area, and prioritizes <Hero's Sidekick> and <Destined Hero>

enemy_10099_crvln.Description: The villain's minion. Its motto is 'Never surrender', and it will fight the heroes to the bitter end to ensure its boss's final victory.
enemy_10099_crvln.Name: Villain's Minion

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.
Attacks hit twice when inside the Filming Area, and prioritizes <Hero's Sidekick> and <Destined Hero>

enemy_10099_crvln_2.Description: The villain. Its motto is 'Never surrender'. This position is reserved for the strong. It spits out special effects shockwaves and watches with glee as the hero's body is torn to pieces and all traces of his existence erased. It will fight to the bitter end.
enemy_10099_crvln_2.Name: Destined Villain

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable
Deals Physical damage to your units along its path when moving
Unable to move when inside the Filming Area and gains <$ba.fragile>Fragile</>
Loses a percentage of Max HP each second after spending too much total time in the Filming Area

enemy_10100_crrol.Description: A mannequin that nimbly darts through the set, controlled by the crew's Arts to carry props. It saves time and manpower, but runs into others from time to time.
enemy_10100_crrol.Name: Nimble Mannequin

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable
Deals Physical damage to your units along its path when moving
Unable to move when inside the Filming Area and gains <$ba.fragile>Fragile</>
Loses a percentage of Max HP each second after spending too much total time in the Filming Area

enemy_10100_crrol_2.Description: A mannequin that nimbly darts through the set. Its duty is to transport props. It will do so even when uncommanded, and it will disembowel anyone who stands in its way.
enemy_10100_crrol_2.Name: Sentient Mannequin

AbilityList.Text: Starts with 5 Film, firing them as ranged attacks. Performs melee attacks when out of Film or blocked

Film explodes when it hits an allied unit or reaches the target location, dealing damage and inflicting Nervous Impairment, and dealing splash damage and inflicting Nervous Impairment on nearby allied units
Film must be attacked 6 times to defeat
Film flies much slower when inside the Filming Area

enemy_10101_crgun.Description: Cameraman carrying heavy equipment. He is unhappy with his job, and he angrily throws film when a shot goes wrong.
enemy_10101_crgun.Name: Unhappy Cameraman

AbilityList.Text: Starts with 5 Film, firing them as ranged attacks. Performs melee attacks when out of Film or blocked

Film explodes when it hits an allied unit or reaches the target location, dealing damage and inflicting Nervous Impairment, and dealing splash damage and inflicting Nervous Impairment on nearby allied units
Film must be attacked 10 times to defeat
Film flies much slower when inside the Filming Area

enemy_10101_crgun_2.Description: Cameraman carrying heavy equipment. He is unhappy with everything, and has already angrily thrown film at whoever is nearest.
enemy_10101_crgun_2.Name: Violent Cameraman

AbilityList.Text: Film explodes when it hits an Operator or reaches the target location, dealing damage and inflicting <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>. Deals splash damage and inflicts <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> on nearby operators
Film must be attacked 6 times to defeat
Film flies much slower when inside the Filming Area

enemy_10102_crblt.Description: A scrapped tape of film thrown by a cameraman after a shot went wrong.
enemy_10102_crblt.Name: Scrapped Film

AbilityList.Text: Film explodes when it hits an Operator or reaches the target location, dealing damage and inflicting <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>. Deals splash damage and inflicts <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> on nearby operators
Film must be attacked 10 times to defeat
Film flies much slower when inside the Filming Area

enemy_10102_crblt_2.Description: A completely scrapped tape of film that explodes in front of the camera, resolved to go out in a blaze of glory.
enemy_10102_crblt_2.Name: Completely Scrapped Film

AbilityList.Text: [Eternal Dust] Several Particles orbit this unit, dealing True damage and causing knockback when they collide with an enemy.

enemy_3006_tersia.Description: A humble hero, a radiant dream. The future converges in her gaze, while the path fades beneath her steps.
enemy_3006_tersia.Name: Theresa, King of Sarkaz

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Gains significantly increased Movement Speed after being attacked

enemy_2001_duckmi.Description: A famous Columbian investor, entrepreneur, and master of 'Duck Power.' Out of the public eye, enjoys kicking back with others...
enemy_2001_duckmi.Name: Duck Lord

enemy_2002_bearmi.Description: The Ursus security guard hired by Duck Lord. Powerful, but not very smart. Mainly responsible for carrying luggage for Duck Lord.
enemy_2002_bearmi.Name: Gopnik

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>
Attacks <$ba.stun>Stun</> the target

enemy_2034_sythef.Description: A Perro who left his family to seek out a new life... but all that people know is that he is always weeping.
enemy_2034_sythef.Name: Crying Thief

AbilityList.Text: Always faces the direction with the most Operators.
Takes 80% less Physical/Arts damage from the front.

enemy_2085_skzjxd.Description: Duck Lord's associate and apprentice, an opportunist with a slick tongue. Frequently appears on dubious TV shows, preaching about how he cares little for losses or gains, as they are part of the natural money-making process.
enemy_2085_skzjxd.Name: Fatty

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>

enemy_2009_csaudc.Description: A diehard fan of the Crimson Troupe, they enjoy the performances night and day. They have become as incomprehensible as the troupe itself.
enemy_2009_csaudc.Name: Derisive Audience

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>
After receiving a certain number of hits, greatly increases all enemies' ASPD for a short period

enemy_2010_csdcr.Description: A performer of the Crimson Troupe, they unleash their singing voices when sufficiently stimulated, inciting their followers to attack in a frenzy.
enemy_2010_csdcr.Name: Scarlet Singer

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by units with at least 4 Block
Attacks deal Splash damage to allied units in a small area around self

enemy_2011_csppt.Description: A gigantic golem maintained by the Crimson Troupe's prop department, they are normally used to move bulky items. They are massive and difficult to block.
enemy_2011_csppt.Name: Theater Golem

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Upon death, deals Arts damage to all surrounding units and inflicts <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>

enemy_2012_csbln.Description: A special gift prepared by the Crimson Troupe for the audience. Every audience member who receives a gift will become particularly 'ecstatic'.
enemy_2012_csbln.Name: 'Small Surprise'

AbilityList.Text: Has a chance to dodge Physical and Arts attacks when not blocked
Can use a skill to deal Physical damage in the surrounding area
Attacks and skills ignore a certain amount of armor and inflict additional <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>

enemy_2017_csphts.Description: A patch of shadow. It has never once left, nor has it ever truly existed.
enemy_2017_csphts.Name: Ominous Apparition

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</>.

enemy_2021_syfish.Description: Sea Terrors travel in large swarms, seeking carcasses to feast on and becoming food for other Sea Terrors themselves.
enemy_2021_syfish.Name: Bone Sea Drifter

AbilityList.Text: When your units enter its attack range for the first time, temporarily stops moving and gains increased DEF.

enemy_2022_syzeni.Description: Sea Terror with a hard shell, protecting the swarm from enemies.
enemy_2022_syzeni.Name: Ocean Stonecutter

AbilityList.Text: Can only attack ground targets
Summons 1 <Baleful Broodling> near the target when dealing damage

enemy_2023_sypult.Description: Sea Terror mothers that throw fake offspring at oncoming threats, allowing the true offspring to flee.
enemy_2023_sypult.Name: Retching Broodmother

AbilityList.Text: Unable to move
Gradually loses HP over time
Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</>.

enemy_2024_synut.Description: An extension of the broodmother's body, identical to newly-born offspring.
enemy_2024_synut.Name: Baleful Broodling

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</>.

enemy_2025_syufo.Description: Some Sea Terrors have begun to adapt to the sky, able to glide above the waves for extended periods. Perhaps this branch will eventually evolve to make their home in the heavens.
enemy_2025_syufo.Name: Skimming Sea Drifter

AbilityList.Text: Dies after some time
Every 3rd attack summons a <Pathshaper Fractal>

enemy_2033_syboys.Description: Fractals left behind by the Seaborn Pathshaper. Illusions must eventually vanish. The path is not clear. Search on, search on.
enemy_2033_syboys.Name: Pathshaper Fractal

AbilityList.Text: Appears around your units
Periodically deals True damage. If there are no targets within attack range, charges up <Ishar'mla, Heart of Corruption>
Disappears when <Ishar'mla, Heart of Corruption> transforms

enemy_2040_syrott.Description: Manifestation of Ishar'mla's explorative and combative nature.
enemy_2040_syrott.Name: Ishar'mla's Tears

AbilityList.Text: Becomes a random enemy when blocked.

enemy_2041_syjely.Description: One of Izumik's evolutionary branches, bringing genetic data collected across Terra back to the mother.
enemy_2041_syjely.Name: Izumik's Offspring

enemy_2035_sybox.Description: Sea Terror disguised as a treasure chest, often used by Bishops of the Deep to protect hideouts.
enemy_2035_sybox.Name: Chest Seaborn

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed significantly increases for a short time after taking damage

enemy_2043_smsbr.Description: A Sami warrior irreversibly corrupted by demons. He once went to the snow fields with a clear purpose, but is now completely bereft.
enemy_2043_smsbr.Name: Tainted Carcass

AbilityList.Text: Movement Speed significantly increases after not attacking for a period of time, resets on attack

enemy_2044_smwiz.Description: A Sami shaman possessed by demons. Everything they understood about nature has been reconstructed into pure nothingness.
enemy_2044_smwiz.Name: Distorted Caster

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.

enemy_2045_smdrn.Description: A drone corrupted by demonic power, now acting like a real lifeform.
enemy_2045_smdrn.Name: Collapsed Construct

enemy_2046_smwar.Description: Once an honorable warrior of the Treescar tribe, now a part of the demons' vanguard, together with their fallen chief.
enemy_2046_smwar.Name: Shattered Champion

enemy_2059_smbox.Description: A seed falls into a box abandoned in the wild, and soon becomes a hunter preying on curiosity.
enemy_2059_smbox.Name: Testaceous Vinecreeps

enemy_2060_smshdw.Description: A soul trapped in the Khagan Nightzmora, which will raise its weapon and follow its eternal general to the ends of the land.
enemy_2060_smshdw.Name: Khaganshadow

enemy_2061_smhond.Description: The proud beastkin have long had close ties to Sargon royalty, some even choosing to serve by a king's side as guardian.
enemy_2061_smhond.Name: Royal Companion

AbilityList.Text: Extends the duration of the current Epoch upon entering the Objective.

enemy_2063_skzlch.Description: A Lich who was once a custodian of the Temple of Knowledge, now lost to the illusions of the furnace for times unknown. He may hail from a Kazdel different from the one you know.
enemy_2063_skzlch.Name: Sarkaz Maze Guide

AbilityList.Text: Attacks hit 2 times when on a Mark of Epoch.

enemy_2064_skzwdd.Description: A Wendigo warrior bound by a promise to his homeland. The heavy tombstone on his back, engraved with the names of his kindred, has often forced him to his knees, but even more often compelled him to rise.
enemy_2064_skzwdd.Name: Sarkaz Maze Returner

AbilityList.Text: When spawned, deals Arts damage to all allied units around its tile and creates a temporary Mark of Epoch.

enemy_2065_skzjs.Description: Born neither from Sarkaz soul nor blood, yet it can deprive both. It is an enigmatic impostor, an unknown plague, a latent curse. It must not be released.
enemy_2065_skzjs.Name: Dreadkaz

AbilityList.Text: Stops attacking and starts channeling to create Marks of Epoch around the Objective.

enemy_2066_skzlcp.Description: A vigilant Lich, one of the many custodians of the Temple of Knowledge. His threads entwine with the sparks in the Soul Furnace, rescuing unwitting wanderers and punishing trespassers.
enemy_2066_skzlcp.Name: Sarkaz Maze Spellweaver

AbilityList.Text: Temporarily removes an Operator from the squad when it disappears.

enemy_2067_skzcy.Description: A portal that follows the living and can occasionally be encountered in the Furnace. Do not fear if it compels you to enter, for it has already prepared an exit.
enemy_2067_skzcy.Name: 'Portal'

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Movement Speed gradually increases. Deals Physical damage to all units upon entering the Objective.

enemy_2068_skzirn.Description: Automaton protecting the Holy City. It can execute its built-in sacrificial ritual to unleash a powerful holy shockwave, commonly known by some Sarkaz as 'self-destruction.'
enemy_2068_skzirn.Name: Holy Automaton

AbilityList.Text: Steals Originium Ingots upon entering the Objective.

enemy_2069_skzbox.Description: An automated thought collector built by a lost Kazdelian empire. It has continuously operated for so long that its movements have become slow and haphazard.
enemy_2069_skzbox.Name: Lost Contraption

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Steals Originium Ingots upon entering the Objective.

enemy_2070_skzfbx.Description: An automated thought collector built by a lost Kazdelian empire. Despite its ability to hover for extended periods, its built-in package protection mechanism compels it to land immediately upon encountering interference.
enemy_2070_skzfbx.Name: Lost Hovercraft

AbilityList.Text: Loads up to 3 allied Operators upon contact. Movement speed is reduced when loaded.
Will not deduct Life Points when entering the Objective Point; loaded allied Operators cannot be placed on the field

enemy_2090_skzjbc.Description: It has no bottom yet never leaks, ferrying passengers from all lands to greener pastures atop a bed of cerulean flames. Only the freed may board this ark.
enemy_2090_skzjbc.Name: Padmasana of Rebirth

AbilityList.Text: Upon defeating the 'Window', the player will enter Prosperity

enemy_2091_skzgds.Description: A solitary window, manifested from all that is bright and beautiful within the dark void. Find the strength to open it, and you will behold prosperity beyond your wildest dreams.
enemy_2091_skzgds.Name: 'Window'

AbilityList.Text: Drops a random Collectible when it enters the Protection Objective; Remaining HP carries over to the next operation

enemy_2093_skzams.Description: The only way to the end.
enemy_2093_skzams.Name: Finale Cadence

AbilityList.Text: Destroyed after taking a certain number of attacks
When attached to a target, deals Arts damage every second and prevents them from using skills

enemy_2101_dyspll.Description: Paper talisman seen throughout the Garden of Grotesqueries, with various messages written on them: Timetables, notes, tips, prohibitions... Endowed with meaning by the hand of man, it stubbornly refuses to leave anyone that it sticks to.
enemy_2101_dyspll.Name: Talisman

AbilityList.Text: When HP drops below a certain level, absorbs a nearby <Talisman> and recovers HP

enemy_2102_dytmbr.Description: A character often seen in Yanese shadow plays, prone to strange encounters in those plays. This Shadowgeist has seen these scenes play out so many times that it believes them to be real, and even warning of the talismans is not enough to dissuade it.
enemy_2102_dytmbr.Name: Shadow Scholar

AbilityList.Text: Starts with 3 <Talismans>; attacks attach a <Talisman> to the target when carrying a <Talisman>

enemy_2103_dykens.Description: Once a wandering physician's medicine bottle, it provided healing to many warriors. When it became a geist, it was moved by a talisman and put the talisman in its bottle, embarking on a journey of chivalry.
enemy_2103_dykens.Name: Bottle Swordsman

AbilityList.Text: Picks a target from very long range, dealing Arts damage and sending a <Talisman>

enemy_2104_dycast.Description: A well-polished mirror that believes it sees everything clearly. When it became a Geist, it was not content with just seeing things, but could not stop itself from giving unsolicited advice, just like the old scholars in the Tianshi Bureau.
enemy_2104_dycast.Name: Mirror Tianshi

AbilityList.Text: When blocked for the first time, devours the blocker and gains <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Returns devoured Operator when defeated

enemy_2105_dyrnge.Description: Similar in appearance to a Feranmut, it looks like an ancient 'God', but it is no more than a mere beast. It has become extinct in modern times, for its greed never diminished, despite no longer having the reputation of the Feranmuts to draw from.
enemy_2105_dyrnge.Name: Pseudomut

AbilityList.Text: Strange Gourd gains increased HP and ATK based on the amount of Originium Ingots owned
Steals Originium Ingots upon entering the Objective.

enemy_2106_dyremy.Description: A gourd that turned into a geist, with an incessant desire for hoarding despite not being particularly active. When disturbed, it tries to draw everything around it into its interior.
enemy_2106_dyremy.Name: Strange Gourd

AbilityList.Text: Explodes upon death, dealing Arts damage to friendly units. Causes even greater damage and stuns friendly units if similar units of the opposite attribute are in its vicinity
Destroyed after taking a certain number of attacks

enemy_2122_dybgzd.Description: Created by Yi to handle various mundane matters, so that he may live in seclusion without being interrupted by official matters.
enemy_2122_dybgzd.Name: Liang

AbilityList.Text: When unblocked, all allied units lose HP constantly

enemy_4001_toxcar.Description: A pesticide spraying vehicle that used to belong to a large nomadic city. It has been retrofitted by Closure to spray tear gas instead, but she didn't have time to install an IFF system.
enemy_4001_toxcar.Name: Retrofitted Gastruck

AbilityList.Text: When unblocked, all allied units lose HP constantly

enemy_4001_toxcar_2.Description: A pesticide spraying vehicle that used to belong to a large nomadic city. It has been retrofitted by Closure to spray tear gas instead, but she didn't have time to install an IFF system. This model has an expanded gas tank and is far more dangerous.
enemy_4001_toxcar_2.Name: Supercharged Gastruck

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
When destroyed, grants a deployable unit
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter

enemy_4002_syokai.Description: Cheap goods sold for scrap from the Kazimierz arenas. Feel free to waste it however you like.
enemy_4002_syokai.Name: Cheap Second-hand Drone

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
When destroyed, grants a deployable unit
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter

enemy_4002_syokai_2.Description: Cheap goods sold for scrap from the Kazimierz arenas. Closure has performed some slight modifications on this batch, but it won't change the fact these are cheap as hell.
enemy_4002_syokai_2.Name: Remodeled Second-hand Drone

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
When destroyed, recovers the SP of nearby Operators
Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter

enemy_4003_pbank.Description: An experimental prototype developed during the early years of a certain Columbian tech company. The objective was to provide power on the battlefield, however due to the lack of a positioning device, it will often leave by itself if unattended to.
enemy_4003_pbank.Name: Mobile Power Source

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Throws exploding soda bottles, dealing True damage around itself (including to itself).

enemy_4004_muvltr.Description: Logistics would soon realize that Engineering's latest supply wagon is a little too... eccentric to transport soda bottles. It has been repurposed to toss exploding soda bottles on the racecourse.
enemy_4004_muvltr.Name: Supply Wagon

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Throws exploding soda bottles, dealing True damage around itself (including to itself).

enemy_4004_muvltr_2.Description: Logistics has realized that Engineering's latest supply wagon is a little too... eccentric to transport soda bottles. It has been repurposed to toss exploding soda bottles on the racecourse, an explosive race the likes of which has never been seen.
enemy_4004_muvltr_2.Name: 'Soda POP!' Supply Wagon

AbilityList.Text: Chance to drop its supply box when taking damage.
HP depletes over time when it loses its supply box.

enemy_4005_musqrl.Description: The Musbeast Supplier likes to carry an oversized supply box on one paw as it scurries around the racecourse. It does so because it thinks it's super strong, and because it can do this, it believes it's super strong.
enemy_4005_musqrl.Name: Musbeast Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Chance to drop its supply box when taking damage.
HP depletes over time when it loses its supply box.

enemy_4005_musqrl_2.Description: The Musbeast Supplier likes to carry an oversized supply box on one paw and flex its biceps as it scurries around the racecourse. It does so because it thinks it's super strong, and because it can do this, it believes it's super strong.
enemy_4005_musqrl_2.Name: 'Big Brawn' Musbeast Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Restores a large amount of HP to all nearby enemies but itself when it takes a certain amount of damage.

enemy_4006_mumole.Description: Logistics belatedly realized that sighting one sandbeast often means the presence of a dozen. They have been trained to serve as suppliers now, but there is always the risk of tripping over the supplies they scatter all over the place.
enemy_4006_mumole.Name: Sandbeast Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Restores a large amount of HP to all nearby enemies but itself when it takes a certain amount of damage.

enemy_4006_mumole_2.Description: Logistics belatedly realized that sighting one sandbeast often means the presence of a dozen. They have been trained to serve as suppliers now, but the medical room is filled with competitors who tripped over the supplies they scattered all over the place.
enemy_4006_mumole_2.Name: 'Faircare' Sandbeast Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Damage from the front is greatly reduced.
Always faces the side where you have more units.

enemy_4007_murino.Description: No one understands the danger of the Rhodes Island arena better than a Burdenbeast Supplier. When it saw a ball hit by an Operator's claymore smash through the arena's wall, it couldn't help but cry out, 'Moo, moo!'
enemy_4007_murino.Name: Burdenbeast Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Damage from the front is greatly reduced.
Always faces the side where you have more units.

enemy_4007_murino_2.Description: No one understands the danger of the Rhodes Island arena better than a Burdenbeast Supplier. When it saw a ball hit by an Operator's claymore smash through the arena's wall, it's urgent moos must have meant, 'Please save me, God of Burdenbeasts!'
enemy_4007_murino_2.Name: 'Timidthy' Burdenbeast Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Performs 5 heavy blows with greatly increased ATK. An attack that defeats a unit does not use up a count.
When out of attack counts, cannot attack and takes significantly more damage for some time.

enemy_4008_mucat.Description: It is unusual, but not unheard of, to be injured when an arena cleaning cart runs over your toes. Things become somewhat surreal when there's an adorable beast on the cart eager to whoop you with a squeaky hammer.
enemy_4008_mucat.Name: Hammer Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Performs 5 heavy blows with greatly increased ATK. An attack that defeats a unit does not use up a count.
When out of attack counts, cannot attack and takes significantly more damage for some time.

enemy_4008_mucat_2.Description: It is unusual, but not unheard of, to be injured when an arena cleaning cart runs over your toes. Things become somewhat scary when there's an adorable beast on the cart trying to whoop you for no reason with a squeaky hammer.
enemy_4008_mucat_2.Name: 'Rampage' Hammer Supplier

AbilityList.Text: Deals more damage to [Foldable Bastion].

enemy_4009_murgby.Description: The Ironhead Forward is known for his headdown tackles, headlong rushes, and headstrong nature.
enemy_4009_murgby.Name: Ironhead Forward

AbilityList.Text: Deals more damage to [Foldable Bastion].

enemy_4009_murgby_2.Description: The Ironhead Forward has his own motto: Find a heading, and head there headfirst.
enemy_4009_murgby_2.Name: 'Charger' Ironhead Forward

AbilityList.Text: Deals more damage to [Foldable Bastion].
Prioritizes attacking units on [Foldable Bastions].
Cannot be blocked.

enemy_4010_mubsbl.Description: A once-in-a-generation pitcher who was born to throw. Ordinary ballgames have lost their appeal; he prefers the thrill of throwing at people.
enemy_4010_mubsbl.Name: Long-Armed Pitcher

AbilityList.Text: Deals more damage to [Foldable Bastion].
Prioritizes attacking units on [Foldable Bastions].
Cannot be blocked.

enemy_4010_mubsbl_2.Description: A once-in-a-generation pitcher who was born to throw. His grandfather once served in Gaul's grenadier battalion, so it's no wonder that he enjoys throwing at people.
enemy_4010_mubsbl_2.Name: 'True Shot' Long-Armed Pitcher

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking the football towards your goal.

enemy_4012_mumssi.Description: This musbeast was recruited as shooter under the reasoning that if it can leap high, it can kick a ball very, very far away.
enemy_4012_mumssi.Name: Field Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking the football towards your goal.

enemy_4012_mumssi_2.Description: This musbeast was recruited as shooter under the reasoning that if it can leap high, it can kick a ball very, very far away. I mean really far away.
enemy_4012_mumssi_2.Name: 'Longshot' Field Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking the football towards your goal.

enemy_4013_mubufn.Description: This burdenbeast was recruited as goalkeeper under the reasoning that its head is so big that it can block the goal just by standing there.
enemy_4013_mubufn.Name: Field Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking the football towards your goal.

enemy_4013_mubufn_2.Description: This burdenbeast was recruited as goalkeeper under the reasoning that its head is so big that it can block the goal just by standing there. There is even the off-chance that it catches the ball between its horns.
enemy_4013_mubufn_2.Name: 'Brain Barrier' Field Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking your Operators.

enemy_4014_mugnfu.Description: Can't lose if the opponent has no players left. If one swing doesn't do it, swing again.
enemy_4014_mugnfu.Name: Field Bludgeoner

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking your Operators.

enemy_4014_mugnfu_2.Description: Can't lose if the opponent has no players left. If one swing doesn't... Nah, one swing always does it.
enemy_4014_mugnfu_2.Name: 'Basher' Field Bludgeoner

AbilityList.Text: A standard football.
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4015_musucr.Description: A football that imitates RMA70 minerals to enrich the match experience. Its spikes are surprisingly benign. Players who have tried it say that kicking it is a highly interactive experience.
enemy_4015_musucr.Name: RMA70 Spikeball

AbilityList.Text: A very light football that can be easily moved.
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4016_mubuln.Description: A football that imitates a furry critter to enrich the match experience... Hey, where did it go? Okay, it's actually a real furry critter that's drifting through the air right now.
enemy_4016_mubuln.Name: Fluffy Pink Balloon

AbilityList.Text: A heavy football that is hard to move.
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4017_muinbl.Description: A football made from compressed building materials to enrich the match experience. 'Heavy' doesn't begin to describe it. Do your foot a favor and don't bother kicking it.
enemy_4017_muinbl.Name: Compressed Ball

AbilityList.Text: Chance to explode when kicked, stunning and damaging nearby units.
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4018_muboom.Description: A football that imitates infused... Hey, why is it moving? Okay, it's actually a genuine infused Originium slug. Genuinely explosive, too!
enemy_4018_muboom.Name: Infused Originium Ball

AbilityList.Text: Gives 3x score.
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4019_mugold.Description: A football that looks like Originite Prime to enrich the match experience. Not actual Originium, so it is perfectly safe and does not explode.
enemy_4019_mugold.Name: Originite Prime Ball

AbilityList.Text: A very bouncy football.
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4020_muboun.Description: A football inspired by an extremely unstable entity to enrich the match experience. It is as unpredictable as its inspiration, and has already been bouncing all over the field for half an hour... Somebody stop it, please!
enemy_4020_muboun.Name: Perpetual Rebounder

AbilityList.Text: Shoots quicker and aims in a direction where there are no <Positional Barriers>

enemy_4022_mushtm.Description: The Tactical Team is known for its tactical acumen and superb tactical equipment. Tactical Team Shooters equipped with thermal-imaging goggles can shoot with unerring accuracy in any condition, which is why they prefer to play in fog.
enemy_4022_mushtm.Name: Tactical Team Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Shoots quicker and aims in a direction where there are no <Positional Barriers>

enemy_4022_mushtm_2.Description: Elite members of the Tactical Team are said to have been baptized by fire in battle. Elite Tactical Team Shooters equipped with thermal-imaging goggles can shoot with unerring accuracy in any condition, which is why they prefer to play in fog.
enemy_4022_mushtm_2.Name: Elite Tactical Team Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Kickoffs are more powerful and aims in a direction where there are no <Positional Barriers>

enemy_4023_mushtb.Description: The Tactical Team is known for its tactical acumen and superb tactical equipment. Tactical Team Goalies equipped with binocular goggles can find any gaps in the opposing formation and kick the ball directly into the opposing goal.
enemy_4023_mushtb.Name: Tactical Team Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Kickoffs are more powerful and aims in a direction where there are no <Positional Barriers>

enemy_4023_mushtb_2.Description: Elite members of the Tactical Team are said to have been baptized by fire in battle. Elite Tactical Team Goalies equipped with binocular goggles can find any gaps in the opposing formation and kick the ball directly into the opposing goal.
enemy_4023_mushtb_2.Name: Elite Tactical Team Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes searching for your units that dealt damage to opposing players

enemy_4024_mushtg.Description: The Tactical Team is known for its tactical acumen and superb tactical equipment. Tactical Team Hitters equipped with vital monitors and warning systems can quickly locate opposing players attempting to hurt their teammates. Watch out—they have already found you.
enemy_4024_mushtg.Name: Tactical Team Hitter

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes searching for your units that dealt damage to opposing players

enemy_4024_mushtg_2.Description: Elite members of the Tactical Team are said to have been baptized by fire in battle. Elite Tactical Team Hitters equipped with vital monitors and warning systems can quickly locate opposing players attempting to hurt their teammates. Watch out—they have already found you.
enemy_4024_mushtg_2.Name: Elite Tactical Team Hitter

AbilityList.Text: Dribbles for a period of time after touching the ball, increasing movement speed and taking up +1 Block

enemy_4025_muhrym.Description: Members of the Ball Mania Club have such love for football that they have taken to the field dressed up as one. Ball is love, ball is life.
enemy_4025_muhrym.Name: Ball Mania Club Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Dribbles for a period of time after touching the ball, increasing movement speed and taking up +1 Block

enemy_4025_muhrym_2.Description: Honorary members of the Ball Mania Club are one with the ball, physically and spiritually. Ball is love, ball is life.
enemy_4025_muhrym_2.Name: Ball Mania Club Honorary Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes kicking off the ball to a shooter

enemy_4026_muhryb.Description: Members of the Ball Mania Club have such love for football that they have taken to the field dressed up as one. These goalies are so attuned to the ball that their passes never miss their mark.
enemy_4026_muhryb.Name: Ball Mania Club Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes kicking off the ball to a shooter

enemy_4026_muhryb_2.Description: Honorary members of the Ball Mania Club are one with the ball, physically and spiritually. These goalies are so attuned to the ball that their passes never miss their mark.
enemy_4026_muhryb_2.Name: Ball Mania Club Honorary Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes searching for your units near the ball

enemy_4027_muhryg.Description: Members of the Ball Mania Club have such love for football that they have taken to the field dressed up as one. This love has slowly grown into a dangerous obsession. Careful, you may not want to let them see you kick their beloved ball.
enemy_4027_muhryg.Name: Ball Mania Club Hitter

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes searching for your units near the ball

enemy_4027_muhryg_2.Description: Honorary members of the Ball Mania Club are one with the ball, physically and spiritually. The ball is all that matters to them, nothing else. Careful, you may not want to let them see you kick their beloved ball.
enemy_4027_muhryg_2.Name: Ball Mania Club Honorary Hitter

AbilityList.Text: Shots are more powerful, and the ball damages any of your units it touches

enemy_4028_mukfum.Description: For Sportsmen United, taking out all the opponent's players is the surest way to victory. The spikes on Sportsmen United Shooters make defending against them a daunting prospect.
enemy_4028_mukfum.Name: Sportsmen United Shooter

AbilityList.Text: Shots are more powerful, and the ball damages any of your units it touches

enemy_4028_mukfum_2.Description: Sportsmen United veterans take it upon themselves to uphold the Positional Football tradition of taking out opposing players. The spikes on Sportsmen United Veteran Shooters make defending against them a daunting prospect.
enemy_4028_mukfum_2.Name: Sportsmen United Veteran Shooter

AbilityList.Text: When HP drops below 50%, gains increased ATK and DEF, temporarily stops defending the goal and starts attacking your players

enemy_4029_mukfub.Description: For Sportsmen United, taking out all the opponent's players is the surest way to victory. Sportsmen United Goalies may look mild-mannered, but they can be terrifying when angered.
enemy_4029_mukfub.Name: Sportsmen United Goalie

AbilityList.Text: When HP drops below 50%, gains increased ATK and DEF, temporarily stops defending the goal and starts attacking your players

enemy_4029_mukfub_2.Description: Sportsmen United veterans take it upon themselves to uphold the Positional Football tradition of taking out opposing players. Sportsmen United Veteran Goalies may look mild-mannered, but they can be terrifying when angered.
enemy_4029_mukfub_2.Name: Sportsmen United Veteran Goalie

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking your units, high ATK

enemy_4030_mukfug.Description: For Sportsmen United, taking out all the opponent's players is the surest way to victory. No one knows if the hammers carried by Sportsmen United Hitters are really made of iron. No one wants to find out the hard way.
enemy_4030_mukfug.Name: Sportsmen United Hitter

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking your units, high ATK

enemy_4030_mukfug_2.Description: Sportsmen United veterans take it upon themselves to uphold the Positional Football tradition of taking out opposing players. No one knows if the hammers carried by Sportsmen United Veteran Hitters are really made of iron. No one wants to find out the hard way.
enemy_4030_mukfug_2.Name: Sportsmen United Veteran Hitter

AbilityList.Text: Becomes smaller when kicked, requiring less damage to move
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4031_muftsn.Description: An Originium beetle plays the part of the football. It sucks in air to expand rapidly when it feels threatened, but this one seems to have a leak and keeps getting flatter as it rolls.
enemy_4031_muftsn.Name: Leaking Beetleball

AbilityList.Text: Becomes bigger when kicked, requiring more damage to move
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4032_muftmg.Description: An Originium beetle plays the part of the football. It sucks in air to expand rapidly when it feels threatened, to scare away predators, but this just makes it all the more adorable to those present.
enemy_4032_muftmg.Name: Bloated Beetleball

AbilityList.Text: Leaves behind slippery ice on the ground
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4033_muftic.Description: A ball made in the image of the indomitable will of the north. Like its inspiration, its mere presence summons snow and ice. Anyone up for a game of ice hockey?
enemy_4033_muftic.Name: Will of the North Ball

AbilityList.Text: Leaves behind sticky slime on the ground
Can only be blocked by a Goalkeeper or unit with Block Count of 3 or higher.

enemy_4034_muftgl.Description: A ball made in the image of a strange sea creature. Like its inspiration, it excretes a mucous slime, but it is unable to slide smoothly. Instead, it gets stuck in its own slime all the time.
enemy_4034_muftgl.Name: Deep Sea Slider Ball

AbilityList.Text: Gains significantly increased ASPD for every 20% HP lost

enemy_4035_mufbsa.Description: Monument that Engineering made from leftover materials. A few had too much time on their hands and gave it the ability to move. After all, there is nothing in the rules that addresses what to do if the ball gets flattened into a pancake.
enemy_4035_mufbsa.Name: Monument to Force

AbilityList.Text: Takes up more Blocks for every 20% HP lost

enemy_4036_mufbsb.Description: Monument that Engineering made from leftover materials. A few had too much time on their hands and gave it the ability to move. After all, no one is foolish enough to try to stop something this big on the field.
enemy_4036_mufbsb.Name: Monument to Toughness

AbilityList.Text: Gains significantly increased ATK for every 20% HP lost

enemy_4037_mufbsc.Description: Monument that Engineering made from leftover materials. A few had too much time on their hands and gave it the ability to move. With enough skill, even a club can penetrate the target like a javelin.
enemy_4037_mufbsc.Name: Monument to Accuracy

AbilityList.Text: Gains significantly increased ATK for every 20% HP lost

enemy_4038_mufbsd.Description: Monument that Engineering made from leftover materials. A few had too much time on their hands and gave it the ability to move. The fire in its hand never goes out. If it did though, all it would need to do is relight it from its head.
enemy_4038_mufbsd.Name: Monument to Passion

AbilityList.Text: Gains significantly increased Movement Speed for every 20% HP lost

enemy_4039_mufbse.Description: Monument that Engineering made from leftover materials. A few had too much time on their hands and gave it the ability to move. No one notices that the cleaning cart at the head of the course is faster than any of the race cars.
enemy_4039_mufbse.Name: Monument to Swiftness

AbilityList.Text: Can attack up to 4 targets at once and ignites targets it attacks, dealing Immolation damage over time
Self-immolates when blocked, dealing heavy damage
Gains significantly increased ASPD when HP drops to half

enemy_1050_lslime.Description: A massive infected beast. These aberrations were born in a special high-temperature environment. Nobody wants to approach these creatures due to their grotesque appearance and the extreme heat they give off. The existence of these giant creatures has been known since ancient times, but to see one warped by infection is terrifyingly unforgettable...
enemy_1050_lslime.Name: 'Pompeii'

AbilityList.Text: Launches grenades when not being blocked, significantly reducing the DEF of the target and surrounding allies for a short period of time
Gains significantly increased ATK when HP is under 50%

enemy_1500_skulsr.Description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who serves in the Assault Squad. Though armed with an Originium launcher and explosives, reports show that he possesses high mobility and poses a significant threat even in melee combat.He has been seen several times around Lungmen, and intel suggests that he is carrying out some special operation in the region.
enemy_1500_skulsr.Name: Skullshatterer

AbilityList.Text: When blocked, can quickly move behind the unit

enemy_1502_crowns.Description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who handles infiltration and assassination operations, specializing in melee combat and breaking through defensive lines. Her stealth and superb infiltration abilities have foiled countless attempts to capture her.
enemy_1502_crowns.Name: Crownslayer

AbilityList.Text: [Stellar Corona] Deals Arts damage to all allied units within range
[Burning Breath] Causes an allied unit within attack range to take True damage that gradually increases (Deals increasing True damage each second, but can be <$ba.buffres>Resisted</>)
Deals True damage when blocked
When HP drops below half, gains greatly increased DEF and RES and uses skills more often

enemy_1503_talula.Description: The leader and spokesperson of Reunion. So far, she has been confirmed to have masterminded multiple riots, as well as the destruction of Chernobog.
enemy_1503_talula.Name: Talulah

AbilityList.Text: Can use explosives to deal heavy Physical damage to allied units
Uses more explosives when HP is under 50%

enemy_1504_cqbw.Description: A Sarkaz Mercenary and one of Reunion's squad leaders, she carries around a weapon that resembles a Laterano Gun. However, she almost exclusively attacks using explosives and throwing weapons. One of her common strategies is to attack the enemy's flank using large amounts of active Originium explosives. However, her erratic movements make her almost impossible to predict...
enemy_1504_cqbw.Name: W

AbilityList.Text: Frequently attacks allied units within range with Ice Nova, dealing heavy Arts damage and reducing the ASPD of affected units for a few seconds
Can Freeze the ground with Arts, rendering them unable to be deployed upon
Revives after dying for the first time, gaining increased ATK

enemy_1505_frstar.Description: A Caster who is one of Reunion's squad leaders. She is one of the few Casters capable of suppressing enemies in a head-on engagement. Among the squads she leads, the special 'Yeti Squadron' assists her in some special operations. As her name implies, she has a cold personality.
enemy_1505_frstar.Name: FrostNova

AbilityList.Text: Doubles the HP regeneration of all enemies on the field
Regular attacks heal 3 enemies simultaneously

enemy_1507_mephi.Description: A Medic who is one of Reunion's squad leaders, often working in tandem with Faust.
