The next attack deals heavy Physical damage to the target. Recovers all SP if this skill kills the target or if the target retreats.

enemy_2075_skgly2.Description: The strongest Goliath warrior. Though he never mentions his name, this champion is destined to become one of the Six Heroes. He has chosen to forsake his mortal wounds, giving his all to his trusted friend and king.
enemy_2075_skgly2.Name: Champion of Lost Agonies

AbilityList.Text: Switches position with Mon2tr when HP drops below 50%, dealing Physical damage to all nearby allied units and <$ba.stun>stunning</> them for several seconds.

enemy_2076_skzklz.Description: The mediator hesitantly makes a choice that allows no further hesitation: to face the challenge of the Six Heroes. She will fail, and they will succeed.
enemy_2076_skzklz.Name: Kal'tsit

AbilityList.Text: Switches position with Evolving Monster when HP drops below 50%, dealing Physical damage to all nearby allied units and <$ba.stun>stunning</> them for several seconds.

enemy_2077_skklz2.Description: The mediator makes a resolute choice that allows no hesitation: to confront the challenge of the Six Heroes. Time is short, but she will neither fail nor surrender. She will fight to the bitter end.
enemy_2077_skklz2.Name: The Doomsday Prophet

AbilityList.Text: Upon switching positions or death, deals Physical damage to all nearby allied units and <$ba.stun>stuns</> them for several seconds.

enemy_2078_skzmst.Description: The mediator's guardian and companion. It will fail, and they will succeed.
enemy_2078_skzmst.Name: Mon2tr

AbilityList.Text: Upon switching positions or death, deals Physical damage to all nearby allied units and <$ba.stun>stuns</> them for several seconds.

enemy_2079_skmst2.Description: The mediator's guardian and companion. It will always choose obedience over admonition, trusting that its master's choice will bring the only hope in this disaster.
enemy_2079_skmst2.Name: Evolving Monster

AbilityList.Text: First Form
[Improvised Defense] Gains 1 Attack Energy charge periodically, up to 3 charges. Each charge reduces Physical and Arts damage taken. The next attack expends all charges.
['Sarcophagus of Exile'] When Fremont, Enlightener of Minds is on the field, allied Operators who retreat or are defeated will each be sealed in a 'Sarcophagus of Exile' until it is defeated.
Second Form
[Punishment of Foolishness] Upon resurrection, charges up briefly before redeploying all operators on the field to random locations.
Attacks deal <$ba.dt.apoptosis>Necrosis</>
Third Form
When your mind is Fractured, Fremont, Enlightener of Minds, will enter Third Form.
Immediately seals an Operator in a 'Sarcophagus of Exile' and attempts self resurrection. HP recovered upon resurrection scales with the number of 'Sarcophagus of Exile' on the field.

enemy_2080_skzlwy.Description: Leader of the Liches, high arbiter of civil disputes in Kazdel, and above all, an ageless teacher. He does not approve of your dangerous actions within the furnace, and intervenes purely for your own good.
enemy_2080_skzlwy.Name: Fremont, Enlightener of Minds

AbilityList.Text: First Form
[Twins] The closer Theresis and Theresa are, the more damage they deal, and the less Arts and Physical damage they take.
[Brandish] Unleashes a sword wave in a direction after charging up, dealing Physical damage to all allied units in its path.

[Guardian] Periodically attempts to significantly restore Theresa, Black Crowned Sage's SP by launching an energy sphere, which deals massive Arts damage to the first allied unit that it collides with.
Second Form
[Gemini] The closer Theresis and Theresa are, the less Physical and Arts damage they take, and the faster Theresa, Black Crowned Sage's SP recovers.
[Reshape Will] Drains a significant amount of Objective HP after an extended duration into battle.
When your mind is Fractured, defeating Theresis, Black Crowned Lord summons several elite enemies.

enemy_2081_skztxs.Description: Conqueror of the land, whose pen has not marked the ceremonial deed. The responsibility that he and his sister must carry has yet to come, a fact that their crown constantly reminds them of.
enemy_2081_skztxs.Name: Theresis, Black Crowned Lord

AbilityList.Text: [Ritual of Exhortation] More likely to be attacked, retreated units have significantly increased Redeployment Time.
[Ritual of Holy Guard] Physical and Arts damage dealt to Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight, by units outside a certain range is significantly reduced.
Units that have taken damage from Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight gain increased ATK and take more damage.
First Form
[Ritual of Automaton] Periodically summons multiple Holy Automatons.
Second Form
Attacks become ranged and deal Physical splash damage.
[Ritual of Strafing] Locks on to all High Grounds on the field, strafing each one in sequence to deal Physical damage.
[Ritual of Guidance] Immediately summons several Guardian Bulwarks upon entering Second Form.
Third Form
When your mind is Fractured, Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight will enter Third Form, gaining increased ATK and summoning several elite enemies.

enemy_2082_skzdd.Description: An Apostolic Knight who guards the gates to the Holy City. He believes in order and willingly serves the peace brought about by Law, but he has never abandoned his doubts. In time, he will become Kazdel's true 'Patriot.'
enemy_2082_skzdd.Name: Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight

AbilityList.Text: Summons several Lost Contraptions when HP drops below a certain point.
When HP drops below a certain percentage, Movement Speed is significantly increased while Physical and Arts damage taken is significantly reduced.
Steals a large amount of Originium Ingots upon entering the Objective.

enemy_2084_skzcan.Description: A mysterious trader who traverses the currents of history, selling anything that exists in time.
enemy_2084_skzcan.Name: Mr. Goodenough

AbilityList.Text: State of Samadhi
[Tathata] After a period of invulnerability, enters State of Vimutti
[Anapanasati] Periodically summons Aggini of Nila; for every existing Aggini of Nila, Qui'lon takes less Physical and Arts damage, and gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>
[Quenching the Three Fires] Qui'lon periodically deals Arts damage to all units within range of an Aggini of Nila
State of Vimutti

[Anapanasati] Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>; periodically summons Aggini of Nila, and for every existing Aggini of Nila, Qui'lon takes less Physical and Arts damage; periodically summons a wave of enemies, and when the mind is chaotic, summons different enemies
[Wrathful Gaze] Every attack deals Arts damage to all units within range of an Aggini of Nila
[Breaching of the Five Precepts] Unleashes 5 consecutive attacks on the target
[Trikaya] Summons a 'Padmasana of Rebirth' whenever 25% of Max HP is lost; Invulnerable until 'Padmasana of Rebirth' enters the Objective Point
[Upaya] When HP drops to 0% for the first time, removes all allied and enemy units from the field along with all Operators in the Deployment Waiting Zone, then enters State of Ashoka
State of Ashoka
[Debate of the Bodhisattvas] Moves to a new combat map and attacks strike twice; only Operators who were on the 'Padmasana of Rebirth' when it entered the Objective Point can be used

enemy_2089_skzjkl.Description: The enlightened of Terra, an Anasa. His Cakraratna is Civilight Eterna, and his Dharmaparaya is a shattered sword. If the living wishes to be free from their worldly shackles, he will remain among the rubble to preach the Dharma, walking the path of Duhkha once more.
enemy_2089_skzjkl.Name: Qui'lon, Avatar of the Mahasattva

AbilityList.Text: [Vestiges of Creativity] Vestiges of Creativity on the battlefield change direction when they come into contact with Guideposts of the Past or terrain features. When they come into contact with Guideposts of the Past, they release the enemy or allied Operator contained within.
First Form
[Those Who Should Not Be] Amiya takes 50% less Physical and Arts damage, and becomes Invulnerable when HP drops below 50% for the first time

[Recreation of the End] Recovers SP when Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight, Theresis, Black Crowned Lord, Qui'lon, Avatar of the Mahasattva, or Manfred are defeated or leave the battlefield. When SP is at max, casts [Premonition of Continuation].

[Premonition of Continuation] Stops attacking and begins to gradually erase tiles and all units on them. For each Guidepost of the Past or enemy erased, reduces Life Points based on the enemy erased before moving to the next area. Premonition of Continuation SP requirement is greatly reduced when the mind is Fractured.
Second Form
[Afterglow of the Black Crown] Immediately deals one instance of True damage to up to 7 nearby units when entering second form, and whenever she touches a Vestige of Creativity
[Wordless Expectation] Periodically summons one Vestige of Creativity
[Eternal Existence] Erases all enemies, Operators, and Guideposts of the Past, ending the operation

enemy_2092_skzamy.Description: It awaits at the end of each story, taking away every character, shutting the door on every possibility, bringing a close to every narration. It is the imagination of the end, and the end of imagination. It is everything, but it is not someone you know.
enemy_2092_skzamy.Name: 'Amiya', Furnace's Finale

AbilityList.Text: [Ritual of Exhortation] More likely to be attacked, retreated units have significantly increased Redeployment Time.
[Ritual of Holy Guard] Physical and Arts damage dealt to Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight, by units outside a certain range is significantly reduced.
Units that have taken damage from Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight gain increased ATK and take more damage.

enemy_2097_skzfdd.Description: An Apostolic Knight who guards the gates to the Holy City.
enemy_2097_skzfdd.Name: Buldrokkas'tee, Holy Gun-Knight

AbilityList.Text: [Brandish] Unleashes a sword wave in a direction after charging up, dealing Physical damage to all allied units in its path.
[Breaching of the Five Precepts] Unleashes 5 consecutive attacks on the target

enemy_2099_skzfkl.Description: The enlightened of Terra, an Anasa.
enemy_2099_skzfkl.Name: Qui'lon, Avatar of the Mahasattva

AbilityList.Text: Attacks with floating cannon, dealing Arts damage
[Focus] Continuously gains ASPD when attacking the same target (this effect is capped), resets when switching targets or not attacking for a few seconds

enemy_2100_skzfmf.Description: A young Sarkaz general, member of the Military Commission of Kazdel.
enemy_2100_skzfmf.Name: Manfred

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be attacked, will not deplete Life Points on leaving the field
Periodically releases random chemicals that affect the battlefield, and sometimes throws <Talismans>
Turns Statuegeist into <Pseudomut> after a while

enemy_2107_dycant.Description: A mysterious trader who roams the garden and serves as Big Bob's subordinate, selling anything that exists in tomes.
enemy_2107_dycant.Name: Can Doe

AbilityList.Text: Attacks 2 targets simultaneously; starts with <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>, and gains 50% Physical and Arts Dodge when <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</> is active
Absorbs nearby <Talismans> to recover HP and regain <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Periodically selects a Vagary Tile at random and summons a <Talisman>

enemy_2108_dypryg.Description: The mythical Yanese woman who flew up to the twin moons to seek her husband. Ancient myths speak of feats far beyond the possibility of today's mortals, and the boundaries between truth and fiction are often blurred.
enemy_2108_dypryg.Name: Dusk Beauty

AbilityList.Text: Attacks 2 targets simultaneously; attack range increased when <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</> is active
Absorbs nearby <Talismans> to increase ASPD and regain <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>
Periodically selects several Vagary Tiles at random and summons <Talismans>

enemy_2109_dypry2.Description: The legend of Dusk Beauty has become the symbol of the twin moons in folk tradition. If she cannot find her husband even on the moons, perhaps she will leap into the endless void beyond.
enemy_2109_dypry2.Name: Lady of the Twin Moons

AbilityList.Text: When on the battlefield, increase <Ash Spear> and <Crimson Crescent Blade> talent and skill effects
Takes reduced Physical and Arts damage when <Ash Spear> and <Crimson Crescent Blade> are on the field
Periodically heals and removes all negative statuses from the one with the lowest HP among itself, <Ash Spear>, and <Crimson Crescent Blade>

enemy_2114_dylbgg.Description: A famous sword-wielder who was renowned during the Hundred Clan Rebellion, but his benevolence was not enough to rid the people's hearts of darkness.
enemy_2114_dylbgg.Name: Jade Twin-Swords

AbilityList.Text: When blocked, becomes unblockable, gains greatly increased movement speed, and deals Physical damage equal to a percentage of ATK to surrounding targets

enemy_2112_dyhlgy.Description: A famous blade-wielder who was renowned during the Hundred Clan Rebellion, but his loyalty was not enough to quench the fires of war.
enemy_2112_dyhlgy.Name: Crimson Crescent Blade

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
When blocked, it and the unit blocking it take greatly increased Physical and Arts damage

enemy_2110_dyyrzf.Description: A famous spear-wielder who was renowned during the Hundred Clan Rebellion, but his strength was not enough to rid the world of evil.
enemy_2110_dyyrzf.Name: Ash Spear

AbilityList.Text: When on the battlefield, increases <Lord Huan> and <Lord Wenheng> talent and skill effects
Takes reduced Physical and Arts damage when <Lord Huan> and <Lord Wenheng> are on the field
Periodically heals and removes all negative statuses from the one with the lowest HP among itself, <Lord Huan>, and <Lord Wenheng>

enemy_2115_dylbg2.Description: A figure enshrined in the Shrine of Heroes, eldest of the Three Heroes. He will defend good and fight evil if it is the last thing he does. His actions destroyed several warring factions, ensuring Yan's legitimate rule.
enemy_2115_dylbg2.Name: Lord Zhaolie

AbilityList.Text: When blocked, becomes unblockable, gains greatly increased movement speed, and deals Physical damage equal to a percentage of ATK to surrounding targets

enemy_2113_dyhlg2.Description: A figure enshrined in the Shrine of Heroes, second of the Three Heroes. He will retrieve his oath-brother's body for burial if it is the last thing he does.
enemy_2113_dyhlg2.Name: Lord Wenheng

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked
When blocked, it and the unit blocking it take greatly increased Physical and Arts damage

enemy_2111_dyyrz2.Description: A figure enshrined in the Shrine of Heroes, youngest of the Three Heroes. He will stand at the bridgehead and terrify his foes with his gaze if it is the last thing he does. His foes shall dare not pass, many as they are.
enemy_2111_dyyrz2.Name: Lord Huan

AbilityList.Text: Periodically summons stationary <Talismans> in the 8 surrounding tiles
Fishes at a random Vagary Tile, moving any hooked Operator or unit to self; if the hooked unit is an enemy, increases their ASPD and Movement Speed and changes their route
When a long time has passed in the battle, disappears and drains 5 Life Points

enemy_2116_dyyysg.Description: The grandmaster of the Tianshi, able to move heaven and earth, but who has not been seen since he helped establish the House of Yan's rule. Has been seen fishing by the riverside on a fortunebeast.
enemy_2116_dyyysg.Name: Revered Grandmaster

AbilityList.Text: Attacks 2 targets simultaneously; periodically summons stationary <Talismans> in the 8 surrounding tiles
Fishes at 3 random Vagary Tiles, moving any hooked Operator or unit to self; if the hooked unit is an enemy unit, increases their ATK and HP and changes their route
When a long time has passed in the battle, disappears and drains 5 Life Points

enemy_2117_dyyys2.Description: The region of Jiangqi is named after Grand Duke's surname, Jiang. Despite his title, he has never taken office, and has never been seen at court. He has only been glimpsed where the hills meet the waters, where the feet of mankind tread not. Perhaps this is why Tianshi Bureaus are often built in the mountains.
enemy_2117_dyyys2.Name: Grand Duke

AbilityList.Text: First Form
Starts with Hui attribute and attacks 2 targets simultaneously, prioritizing units with the opposite Hui-Ming Attribute
[Amalgam] Periodically enters a casting state to change his Hui-Ming Attribute
[Summon Liangs] Periodically summons <Liangs> from both sides of the map
Second Form
[Amalgam] Periodically enters a casting state to change his Hui-Ming Attribute and gain Barrier
[Summon Liangs] Periodically summons more <Liangs> from both sides of the map

enemy_2118_dylbhm.Description: Build pillars and towers from clouds and earth, and make pairs out of like and like.
enemy_2118_dylbhm.Name: Yi

AbilityList.Text: Does not normally exist on the battlefield; periodically locks on to your unit with the most nearby units, triggering [Sleepless] and remaining on the field for a while
[Sleepless] Forces the target and your units in the 8 surrounding tiles to retreat, creating undeployable tiles for a while
[Shake the Mountains] After [Sleepless] is triggered, slams the ground three times, dealing high Physical damage to all your units, ignoring Camouflage
Triggers a [Sleepless] that forces all units to retreat when HP drops below a certain level
When a long time has passed in the battle, triggers [Sleepless] before disappearing and draining 50 Life Points

enemy_2119_dyshhj.Description: The manifestation of the half-awake god that was defeated by Yan's final shot. A Proxy has taken Its place and appropriated Its context, seemingly attempting to fully awaken It.
enemy_2119_dyshhj.Name: 'Sui'

AbilityList.Text: Does not normally exist on the battlefield; locks on to your unit with the most nearby units, triggering [Sleepless]
[Sleepless] Forces the target and Operators in the 8 surrounding tiles to retreat, temporarily creating undeployable for a while
Triggers [Sleepless] and stays on the battlefield for a while before leaving without draining Life Points

enemy_2119_dyshhj_2.Description: Formed from ink and sculptures, It hides in the clouds, waiting for the opportunity to extinguish the candle of mankind.
enemy_2119_dyshhj_2.Name: 'Body of Sui'

AbilityList.Text: Initial Form
[Placement] Whenever you deploy a unit, deploy a 'Flaw' in one of the 4 adjacent deployable tiles around it
[Placement] Periodically deploys a 'Flaw' on a deployable tile in one of the 4 adjacent tiles around your units that does not already have a unit
First Form
Nearby 'Flaws' will recover a percentage of HP every second and attack nearby your units, stunning them
For every nearby 'Flaw', Physical and Arts damage taken is reduced, and control effect duration is reduced
[Ladder] When a target on the field is 'Emptied', enters full-screen attack mode, prioritizing surrounded targets and attacking up to 3 targets at a time
Second Form
Deploys multiple 'Flaws' when entering second form; if a deployable tile surrounded by 'Flaws' does not have a unit, it will begin to spawn enemies continuously
After reviving, deploys a 'Flaw' on deployable tiles around your units
Leaves the field when the last 'Flaw' is defeated

enemy_2120_dywqgs.Description: The strategist, the sinner, the chess piece laid at the Tomb of Sui.
enemy_2120_dywqgs.Name: 'Wang'

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
When defeated, grants an additional reward

enemy_6001_trsgst.Description: A nimble hand and a quick getaway. Over time, he made a name for himself as the 'Fleet-footed.' Alas, he always ends up stealing more than he can handle and getting caught.
enemy_6001_trsgst.Name: Fleet-footed Thief

AbilityList.Text: After taking damage, gains a layer of Protection (reduces Physical and Arts damage taken) that lasts for several seconds and can stack up to 3 times
Can pass through Operators if blocked.
When defeated, grants an additional reward

enemy_6002_trswlf.Description: A low-profile Perro private detective. He takes on all kinds of investigations, never questioning his clients' identities and always sticking to the rules of the job. However, if he happens to get caught, he's not above trading valuable intel in exchange for his freedom.
enemy_6002_trswlf.Name: Teary Detective

AbilityList.Text: After attacking 3 times, the next attack <$ba.stun>Stuns</> the target (prioritizes units that are not Stunned)
When defeated, grants an additional reward

enemy_6003_trsslm.Description: A native Originium Slug species with vibrant colors. Wild specimens are extremely timid and will emit light to deter predators when escaping. With training, they can light up in a rhythm and are very popular with women and children.
enemy_6003_trsslm.Name: 'Shiny Pooloo'

AbilityList.Text: When HP drops under half, gains greatly increased ATK and takes reduced Physical and Arts damage
Adds a Contaminated Mineral to the Deployment Waiting Zone (maximum of one)
Adds a Heat Cluster to the Preparation Area (When transferred, deals True damage to all allied units and <$ba.stun>Stuns</> them for several seconds)

enemy_6004_pleslm.Description: A domestic Originium Slug that escaped into the wild before mutating in a high-pressure environment. Despite its tremendous size and sturdy crystal back, it is not aggressive and extremely good at 'interacting' with people. It still views them the same way it did when it was merely a house pet, but what was once playful is now truly destructive at its new size.
enemy_6004_pleslm.Name: 'Milan'

AbilityList.Text: Deals a small amount of Arts damage to surrounding units
Applies a <Crude Sphere> to the operator with the highest ATK on the field
Randomly applies a <Crude Sphere> to an Operator in the Deployment Waiting Zone

enemy_6005_llstone.Description: An Originium Arts construct made from mining waste, originally created to maximize the value of the mines. However, this colossus seems to have realized its own origins, and refused to take part in any mining activities before finally turning against the very people who created it. It has raided many mines, and people fearfully call it the 'Mine Killing Mine.'
enemy_6005_llstone.Name: Spherical Colossus

AbilityList.Text: Latches onto an operator, preventing the operator from attacking or using skills
Gradually loses HP

enemy_6006_fystone.Description: Part of the Spherical Colossus, it has no sentience but is very heavy. Don't let it latch on to an Operator.
enemy_6006_fystone.Name: Crude Sphere

AbilityList.Text: Splits into 5 <Fluorescent Originium Slugs> upon death
Periodically adds Fluorescent Spores to the Deployment Waiting Zone, and if there is no space, they will be instead added to the Recuperation Area

enemy_6007_mtslm.Description: This massive fluorescent Originium slug carries an enormous number of larvae in the interstices along its massive mantle, making it travel extremely slowly. This type of Originium slug lives deep underground all year round, so it's impossible to guess why it has appeared here. Though not hostile, it has devoured a large quantity of discarded ores and grown massive in size, significantly interfering with the cleanup process.
enemy_6007_mtslm.Name: 'Drifting Cabin'

enemy_6008_mtslms.Description: A native, soft-shelled Originium slug. It has enormous reproductive capacity, and the fluorescence on its shell is a visible pheromone. After molting, it will grow drastically in size over a short period of time
enemy_6008_mtslms.Name: Fluorescent Originium Slug

AbilityList.Text: Can release 1 type of industrial material when Danger Level increases
Reduce damage taken, but damage reduction does not work on units blocking it
Gains a Barrier equal to a percentage of current max HP when HP drops below 25% for the first time.

enemy_6009_nlkgtbs.Description: Giant Gloompincer with tentacle-shaped mouthparts, increasing its feeding efficiency. It indiscriminately devours the materials left on the industrial platform, and the resulting chemical reactions in its internal organs have turned the cleanup operation into a putrid nightmare.
enemy_6009_nlkgtbs.Name: 'Fruit of Gluttony'

AbilityList.Text: Takes less damage from all units other than the blocker when blocked
Gets knocked down to rest when health drops to a certain percentage; when all HP is restored, gets up again and ASPD increases.

enemy_6010_boxing.Description: An old underground boxer from Rim Billiton, nicknamed from his debut fight as a youth, where he defeated an older champion hungry for competition. Many years later, he lost to someone even younger than him, and left for the wilderness in anger. Relying on his cunning and life experiences over the years, he became a boxing fixer in the wilderness, and even had the beautiful dream of snatching some land in a nomadic city to build a underground boxing arena, but he had no idea that the key to success or failure was never in his hands to begin with.
enemy_6010_boxing.Name: 'Boy Wonder' Sandel

AbilityList.Text: Consumes lifeforce while flying over ground tiles and causes vegetation to grow on tiles it travels over; falls to the ground when HP reaches half
[Growth Hormone] While flying, covers surrounding tiles with vegetation that summons <Small Symbionts>
[Deciduous Hormone] When Operators are transferred, attacks the Operator on the field with the highest DEF and places a [Modified Phytohormone] into the Deployment Waiting Zone

enemy_6011_planty.Description: A newly discovered life form and the largest Originium Slug and flower symbiote on reliable record. Capable of boosting plant growth and Originium Slug reproduction by dispersing its pollen, it can even fly slowly in the air. Some scholars believe that its ability to fly is new evidence of unintelligent organisms actively manipulating complex Originium Arts, while others believe it is nothing more than a naturally occurring phenomenon under hyper-specific conditions. This question has yet to be resolved, as no biologist has been desperate enough to approach it.
enemy_6011_planty.Name: 'Nature's Compromise'

enemy_6012_plants.Description: A symbiont that appears alongside 'Nature's Compromise.' It is difficult to distinguish whether they are biological descendants or Originium Slugs contaminated and assimilated by the pollen. Perhaps a combination of both?
enemy_6012_plants.Name: Small Symbiont

AbilityList.Text: Invulnerable for a period of time after appearing on the field
Periodically summons a hidden Full-Auto Debit Machine that periodically consumes DP
When Danger Level increases, summons a hidden Post-Firing Debt Relief Program that fires long-ranged attacks in a set direction

enemy_6013_smith.Description: Former Mama John's employee. No one knows what she's been through the past few years, but it's clear she doesn't have a favorable impression of her Mama's huge family. She's now brandishing an arsenal of weapons built by her construction crew, and recklessly destroying her Mama's new plate.
enemy_6013_smith.Name: Mama's 'Rebel Girl'

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Whenever a certain percentage of HP is lost, permanently increases the damage inflicted by Poison Haze
Periodically sends a Rupturing Canister to the Preparation Area (grants <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</> to all enemies except 'Tumor' when dispatched)

enemy_6014_crzgas.Description: A bona fide thug from the barrenlands, head to toe. They once merely wandered the wilds, but after spotting a Raythean Industries test platform dealing with a gas leakage, they've decided to risk it all and take over the entire platform to make their fortune.
enemy_6014_crzgas.Name: 'Tumor'

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Periodically dispatches a <Supersweetie Delivery Drone> towards a target, prioritizing Operators on high ground
After being on the field for a period of time, periodically increases the Movement Speed and ASPD of all enemies on the field when not blocked
Periodically enters Speeding Mode. Can no longer be blocked, and deals Physical damage by colliding with allied units

Exits Speeding Mode only after colliding 5 times with an Operator with a Block count of 4 and higher; will stop and be inflicted with <$ba.fragile>Fragile</> for a short period, and Stuns all enemies on the field

enemy_6015_ictruck.Description: A fully automatic ice cream truck made to ensure a steady supply of ice cream. It lost control after a worker accidentally poured syrup into its fuel tank, overriding the core control platform and spraying ice cream everywhere. It is always stirring the milk slurry within itself, and is ready to flash a smile at any customer who comes into view.
enemy_6015_ictruck.Name: 'Supersweetie Smiley'

AbilityList.Text: Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>
Has high DEF and RES, but those can be reduced by healing <Absorbers> to full HP
Spits out filth at set intervals, placing an <Absorber> in the Deployment Waiting Zone and attacking several operators on the field; number of operators attacked increases according to Danger Level

After losing a certain percentage of HP, immediately Stuns multiple Operators on the field and creates a Barrier equal to the HP lost; if the Barrier is not destroyed before it expires, the Barrier shatters and inflicts a large amount of Nervous Impairment to all Operators on the field

When it creates a Barrier for the second time and thereafter, it will stun more Operators if the previous Barrier was not destroyed; this effect can stack up to a number of times, and resets when a Barrier is destroyed

enemy_6016_splash.Description: It once bore an Iberian name, until it tossed that name into the sea and disappeared into the abyss. However, embracing the seawater was not enough to moisten its parched throat, and the clear red liquid flowing within its veins is equally enticing, so it has returned to dry land once more, thirstier than ever.
enemy_6016_splash.Name: Thirster

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Sends a <Supersweetie Superblend> to the Deployment Waiting Zone upon death

enemy_6017_icdrone.Description: A drone originally used to deliver ice cream to remote regions, but after going rogue it now sells to the masses. It has embraced its desire to deliver sweetness everywhere, and insists on submerging everyone in sugar.
enemy_6017_icdrone.Name: Supersweetie Delivery Drone

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Periodically summons drones at its location
When there are drones nearby, gain <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>

[Spread Malice] Summons several <Seeding Drones> and temporarily gives all drones within an area extra ATK and HP. If there are no nearby <Seeding Drones> when skill ends, stops moving and temporarily gains <$ba.fragile>Fragile</>

enemy_6018_carrier.Description: An airborne command center for agricultural drones. Long has it tended the crops in the field, even treating them as its own, but it is nevertheless lonely because of its rootless wandering. Malware has turned its loneliness into hatred for all who dwell on the ground.
enemy_6018_carrier.Name: 'Hatred Without Root'

AbilityList.Text: Every 3rd attack <$ba.stun>Stuns</> your Operators for several seconds

enemy_6019_escort.Description: Agriculture drone equipped with a variety of tools for seeding, watering, fertilizing, etc. It is proud of its role, and of its natural fertilizer fermentation system. 'No one can refuse some steaming hot fertilizer.'
enemy_6019_escort.Name: Seeding Drone

AbilityList.Text: Immune to <$ba.stun>Stun</>, <$ba.frozen>Frozen</>, <$ba.levitate>Levitate</>, <$ba.sleep>Sleep</>; temporarily loses immunity when affected by <Long Live Mead!>
ATK increased after each attack (with stack limit), resets after some time without attacking

[Aged Mead] Throws <Aged Mead> at one of your Operators after losing a percentage of HP. The Operator is <$ba.stun>Stunned</> while <Aged Mead> is on the battlefield. <Aged Mead> can be attacked and is added to the Deployment Waiting Zone as <Long Live Mead!> when defeated
Periodically targets one of your units and throws a can after a delay, dealing Physical splash damage and inflicting<$ba.stun>Stun</>

enemy_6020_orang.Description: The 'ultimate automaton' developed by the Liquor Association, with the power to 'squash ten kegs at the same time.' In accordance with an environmental protection pact with Acahualla, the armor plates are made from recycled kegs. Considered one of the competition's favorites, it went berserk when champagne from the opening ceremony seeped into its control chip.
enemy_6020_orang.Name: 'Spirit of Liquor'

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked, causes the target Operator to be <$ba.stun>Stunned</> while on the battlefield; added to the Deployment Waiting Zone as <Long Live Mead!> when defeated

enemy_6021_cask.Description: Mead that has been aged for more than a decade, with a strong flowery scent. The Liquor Association stole it to deal a blow to the Mead Association, an attempt that resulted in some of its members turning traitor, leading to turmoil within. It has now become a weapon of revenge for the Liquor Association.
enemy_6021_cask.Name: Aged Mead

AbilityList.Text: Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage.
ATK increases with the number of <Squeaking Sounds> on the battlefield.
Takes True damage whenever a <Squeaking Sound> is destroyed.
Places a <Squeaking Sound> in the Deployment Waiting Zone upon entering the battlefield or casting [Mourning Fugue]. Two are placed instead if HP is below 50%.

[Mourning Fugue] Stops attacking to begin casting. While casting, <Squeaking Sounds> are no longer invulnerable, and Arts damage is dealt around this unit and all <Squeaking Sounds> over time. While casting, <Squeaking Sounds> in the Deployment Waiting Zone also drain DP.

enemy_6022_m2cnt.Description: A frustrated noble who rules over a town on the borders of Leithanien. His dream was for his music to be recognized throughout, but a lack of appreciation drove him to solitude and madness. Now, he weaves his music into his Arts, spreading mournful notes in search of resonance.
enemy_6022_m2cnt.Name: 'Count Grimscore'

AbilityList.Text: Loads nearby non-Leader enemies inside as passengers (max 5). Throws 1 passenger when attacking. All passengers are unloaded when this unit is defeated.
ATK, DEF, and HP greatly increased when passengers are loaded.
When <'Really Unruly Creature'> is loaded, unloads all passengers and becomes stunned for an extended period.
[Right-Right-Up-Left] Stops moving but significantly increases its attack range and ASPD for the duration, and immediately draws several nearby enemies to its location.

[Redeem Prize] Binds the Operator with the highest ATK, preventing it from attacking and using skills until this unit leaves the battlefield. Places a <'Really Unruly Creature'> and <Sticky Prize> in the Deployment Waiting Zone when effect expires.

enemy_6023_crane.Description: The secret weapon of Box Inc., and the natural enemy of 'Unruly Creatures.' Looks like a claw machine. Its program has gone haywire, causing it to run amok on the streets of Dossoles, snatching anything within reach. Keep your distance and resist the lure of its glowing neon signs, lest it swallow you too!
enemy_6023_crane.Name: 'Greedy Catcher'

AbilityList.Text: Dies when loaded by 'Greedy Catcher.'

enemy_6024_crnbug.Description: So unruly, it wants to squeeze into your mouth.
enemy_6024_crnbug.Name: 'Really Unruly Creature'

AbilityList.Text: Enters into defensive mode when HP drops below 60% for the first time, gaining temporary Arts and Physical damage reduction, and summoning Witchcraft Orbs.
Periodically fires many witchcraft missiles across the entire field, dealing Physical damage to your units. Prioritizes the 2 allied units closest to it.
Periodically summons Witchcraft Orbs in the 4 adjacent tiles.

enemy_6025_tinker.Description: A war altar imbued with Sarkaz witchcraft. Once abandoned in the ruins of battle, it has been resurrected. Now, the earth trembles in its might and no living being is safe around it. It seeks neither preservation nor remembrance—only a fight to the very end. Surrounded by its creations, it will not go down alone.
enemy_6025_tinker.Name: Altar of Hatred

AbilityList.Text: Upon destruction, deals True damage and stuns all allied units in the surrounding area.

enemy_6026_techn.Description: Stone spheres created by the Altar of Hatred. Sarkaz witchcraft has given them 'life,' yet they seek out the living so that they might perish together.
enemy_6026_techn.Name: Witchcraft Orb

AbilityList.Text: Normally stationary; moves to a different High Ground with her claw hook after some time has elapsed, or if a certain amount of HP is lost. This unit is Aerial while moving.
Periodically hides 'Indisputable Evidence' in your Preparation Area, and reduces DP Cost.
Periodically destroys 1 Indisputable Evidence and performs a powerful attack.
For each Indisputable Evidence, increases ATK while gaining Physical and Arts dodge.
ASPD significantly increases when unblocked.

enemy_6027_bqthie.Description: A Qinggong master renowned for her agility and grace on the rooftops of Yumen. Though her motivations remain unknown, her actions reveal an honorable nature. Her steps are light, her gaze piercing. Yet, it is a pity that her role seems as insignificant as a leaf in the wind.
enemy_6027_bqthie.Name: Ye Wuqing, Rooftop Runner

AbilityList.Text: First Form
Disguised as an occupied L-44 Gramophone; Cannot be attacked
At a certain time, rises and transforms into its second form, leaving behind the Gramophone pedestal; Transforms immediately if the disguised L-44 Gramophone is occupied by allied units
Second Form
Whenever the Danger Level increases, gains a Barrier that absorbs Physical and Arts damage

enemy_6028_cosgia.Description: Old Gramophone that has long lay abandoned in the wilderness, until the song of the pack once again brought life to this place. It was repaired by music lovers to lead the song of the pack, but the conflicting tastes of the aficionados and their uneven skills at reverse-engineering Originium circuits have caused its programming to run amok.
enemy_6028_cosgia.Name: 'Song of the Pack'

AbilityList.Text: Initial Form
Throws <'Woodthreads'> at one of your Operators after losing a percentage of HP; the Operator is Stunned while <'Woodthreads'> is on the battlefield
Reborn Form
When HP is reduced to 0, remains Invulnerable and splits into a large number of <'Twitter'>; [Reborn Form] expires when there are no <'Twitter'> on the battlefield
Returns to initial form if 'Aubade' HP is not at 0 when [Reborn Form] expires
ATK increases when returning from [Reborn Form] to initial form

enemy_6029_solzac.Description: A set of chime bells that turned into a Waregeist. Its previous owner was a musician whose deathbed request was for Miss Du to deliver it to a friend. After it was stolen, it was transformed into a Waregeist by the influence of Sui-Xiang. It makes a poignant sound as it wanders about trying to return to its master, not knowing that its master has already passed away.
enemy_6029_solzac.Name: 'Aubade'

AbilityList.Text: Cannot be blocked.
Must be damaged 25 times to defeat
After coming into contact with <'Aubade'>, disappears and restores the HP of <'Aubade'> by a certain amount
When defeated, reduces the number of <'Twitter'> that <'Aubade'> can split into

enemy_6030_frgzac.Description: A fragment of the body of 'Aubade'. Its mind is hazy like that of a newborn foal, yearning to return to its 'mother'.
enemy_6030_frgzac.Name: 'Twitter'

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked, and causes the target Operator to be <$ba.stun>Stunned</> while on the battlefield; provides 10 Transfer Permits when defeated
Must be damaged 30 times to defeat

enemy_6031_visfrg.Description: A fragment of the pedestal of 'Aubade'. It drifts like feathers, repelling enemies that attempt to obstruct 'Twitter'.
enemy_6031_visfrg.Name: 'Woodthreads'

AbilityList.Text: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block
Has a shield and always faces the last deployed unit, greatly reducing Physical and Arts damage taken from the front
Danger Level rises faster when attacked from the direction of the shield
After moving to a specific location, leaves behind an 'Unwavering Assistant' that faces the same direction with continuously increasing ATK, dealing Physical splash damage

Stops attacking and begins charging when Danger Level increases or when losing a percentage of HP; after charging for a while, performs a special attack against all your units, dealing increased damage to units behind the shield, inflicting <$ba.stun>Stun</>

enemy_6032_fxdjj.Description: Security robot developed by a Dossoles startup specifically for Galería Krysztauowa. They were deep in debt and were counting on this contract to turn things around. Reynell promised to pay within three days of delivery, but never paid a single coin until the company was leveled by the collectors' bulldozers. In fact, he has never even taken this labor of love out of its box—perhaps he just wanted to see smart people driven to madness. Who can possibly know the answer?
enemy_6032_fxdjj.Name: 'Absolute Security' Prototype

AbilityList.Text: Attacks cause the target to receive a certain amount of this unit's ATK as Arts damage per second over a few seconds (stacks)

enemy_7001_blwzad.Description: An apprentice caster who has learned some of the ancient Arts of their tribe. Although not yet proficient with Arts, it is enough to fight whoever they disagree with.
enemy_7001_blwzad.Name: Tribal Shaman

AbilityList.Text: Attacks cause the target to receive a certain amount of this unit's ATK as Arts damage per second over a few seconds (stacks)

enemy_7001_blwzad_2.Description: An elite caster under a Lord Ameer, able to employ a kind of ancient Arts to cast menacing attacks, nicknamed a 'curse' by the locals.
enemy_7001_blwzad_2.Name: Lord Ameer Shaman

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked by friendly units; when attacked, inflicts a certain amount of Arts damage to the attacker

enemy_7002_veingd.Description: A deformed Infected Creature often found wandering around ore veins, stubbornly thinking they have a duty to guard the mine.
enemy_7002_veingd.Name: Vein Guardian

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked by friendly units; when attacked, inflicts a certain amount of Arts damage to the attacker

enemy_7002_veingd_2.Description: A deformed Infected Creature often found wandering around ore veins. Guarding the mines has become an obsession of theirs, and they are willing to die for it.
enemy_7002_veingd_2.Name: Maddened Vein Guardian

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking constructs; when attacking constructs, gains greatly increased ATK

enemy_7003_catapt.Description: A contraption that hurls fruit with rock-hard shells instead of boulders, destroying all constructs in its detection range by targeting their weak points. The designer must surely have been an expert in architecture.
enemy_7003_catapt.Name: 'Anything Can Be Broken'

AbilityList.Text: Prioritizes attacking constructs; when attacking constructs, gains greatly increased ATK

enemy_7003_catapt_2.Description: A contraption that hurls fruit with rock-hard shells instead of boulders, destroying all constructs in its detection range by targeting their weak points. After some upgrades, it is powerful enough to destroy large buildings.
enemy_7003_catapt_2.Name: 'Everything Should Be Smashed'

AbilityList.Text: After being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time

enemy_7004_xbdeer.Description: A herbivorous beast commonly found almost anywhere in the wild. It has small but sharp horns and is not aggressive, but will run and jump to avoid attacks when frightened. The meat is very tender.
enemy_7004_xbdeer.Name: Leporibeast Shorthorn

AbilityList.Text: After being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time

enemy_7004_xbdeer_2.Description: A herbivorous beast commonly found almost anywhere in the wild. It has grown large horns, but will still run away on reflex, jumping even higher and faster. The meat is very tender.
enemy_7004_xbdeer_2.Name: Leporibeast Longhorn

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked
Gradually restores HP over time

enemy_7005_xbbull.Description: A beast with moss growing on its back, appearing round and gentle but it is actually fierce with a terrible temper. The moss on its body has a hemostatic effect, and it will eat it when injured.
enemy_7005_xbbull.Name: Mossback Beast

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked
Gradually restores HP over time

enemy_7005_xbbull_2.Description: A beast with moss all over its body, easily agitated compared to others of its kind because of tiny, hard-to-remove bugs hiding in its vegetation. The moss grows back extremely quickly, and it will sometimes eat some even when uninjured.
enemy_7005_xbbull_2.Name: Lush Mossback Beast

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked

enemy_7006_xbcrab.Description: A crab-like creature with rocks on its shell that it uses to camouflage itself. Extremely tenacious, it can sometimes be found far from sources of water. A distant relative of Metal Crabs, but its meat is delicious.
enemy_7006_xbcrab.Name: Cragpincer

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked

enemy_7006_xbcrab_2.Description: A Cragpincer with crystals on its shell, not only eye-catching but also extremely beautiful. However, it is also harder to handle. The completely crystallized carapace is a popular ornament once properly processed. It is said that some people also keep these as ornamental pets.
enemy_7006_xbcrab_2.Name: Crystalline Cragpincer

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked

enemy_7015_xbcrab2.Description: A Cragpincer with a gigantic crystallized shell, its back broad enough to carry two average-sized cragpincers. If it can withstand the weight of two cragpincers and the crystals on its back, who knows how strong it actually is, so do be careful of its pincers!
enemy_7015_xbcrab2.Name: 'Consortium of Pincers'

AbilityList.Text: After being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time
Moves through different areas

enemy_7007_xbbird.Description: An extremely rare and exquisite beast. It feeds on rhizomes, giving its coat a dense but fine light golden luster. When on the move, it's almost as if golden sand was falling from its body, so it is highly sought by collectors and artists. However, it is extremely nimble and difficult to capture, but is the secret ingredient spoken of in legends... do you really want to hunt it?
enemy_7007_xbbird.Name: Sandfall Crystalhoof

AbilityList.Text: Automatically locates and attacks Ore Veins, returning spoils to the Harvester Hub

enemy_7008_wrkwrk.Description: Basic mechanical workers capable of gathering and transporting resources. Their capacity is not very large but they are industrious and diligent.
enemy_7008_wrkwrk.Name: Basic Harvester

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked
Recovers a percentage of its own HP when an allied unit is retreated or defeated within range

enemy_7009_mtmoun.Description: A warrior of unknown background who wears exquisite but tattered armor. He strides forward, sand cupped within his hands, no longer responsive to anyone.
enemy_7009_mtmoun.Name: 'The Immortal'

AbilityList.Text: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked.
Can turn into an aerial unit for a period of time
When flying, deals ranged splash Arts damage, also inflicting <$ba.dt.burning>Burn</>

enemy_7010_bldrgn.Description: An extremely silent Great Wingbeast. This Infected creature has a pair of crystallized wings bigger than its body, but cannot fly too high or for too long. A ferocious carnivore, but this one seems to have had its meal, and is merely curious about the tiny things that have appeared before it.
enemy_7010_bldrgn.Name: Great Wingbeast

AbilityList.Text: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>, blinks forward a short distance when blocked

enemy_7011_paki.Description: A Sargonian assassin available for hire. Extremely agile with their unusual footwork. If the pay is generous enough, they are also willing to take on non-assassination work at their own discretion, and charge by the hour.
enemy_7011_paki.Name: Sargonian Contract Assassin

AbilityList.Text: First Form
When not blocked, damage taken is significantly reduced
Second Form
Gains greatly increased ATK, ASPD, and Movement Speed

enemy_7012_wilder.Description: The advance linebreaker officer under the command of a Sargonian Lord Ameer. He cares for nothing but removing all obstacles in his way, fearing neither life nor death. He is the strongest and bravest soldier in the entire army.
enemy_7012_wilder.Name: Dauntless Linebreaker

AbilityList.Text: Less likely to be attacked
First Form
Summons 2 <Infused Originium Slugs> for assistance
Second Form
Summons 2 <Infused Originium Slugs> and 2 <Infused Originium Slug αs>

enemy_7013_slwazd.Description: An elite Caster honored by the local Lord Ameer, capable of manipulating Infected creatures to fight. Destroying their enemies is merely a side effect of the ultimate destruction that they wish to see.
enemy_7013_slwazd.Name: 'The Ruinbringer'

AbilityList.Text: First Form
Can only be blocked by units with at least 2 Block
After 3 attacks, the next attack deals heavy Splash Physical damage
When defeated deals Physical damage and Stuns surrounding allied units for a few seconds
Second Form
Pilot does not attack nor move, becomes <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>, and reflects physical damage while repairing the mech
After some time, they return to the mech and it returns to its first form

enemy_7014_dva.Description: Elite armored corps of a Lord Ameer operating their self-assembled armor. Its self-destruct system is the only part they are unsatisfied with, and it is obvious they care more about their beloved machine than the Lord Ameer's orders.
enemy_7014_dva.Name: 'Al-Rafiq'

AbilityList.Text: [Conflagration] After attacking twice, the next attack Stuns the target, increases this unit's ATK, and deals Arts damage to all friendly units.

enemy_8006_flmgd.Description: Molten weapons given form, their extinguished flames rekindled upon command. They will not stop until the enemies at bladepoint are reduced to ashes.
enemy_8006_flmgd.Name: Reforged Retinue

AbilityList.Text: More likely to be attacked. When attacked, inflicts a certain amount of True damage on surrounding allied units.
Continuously <$ba.stun>stuns</> surrounding allies.
Disappears when touched by another enemy, granting that enemy bonus Max HP and ATK. When that enemy is defeated, a <V.T.E.> is created where they fall.
Leaves a Matrix on the field when destroyed. Allies within the Matrix gain bonus Max HP and ATK, and take less Physical and Arts damage.
Self-destructs after being on the field for some time, dealing Arts damage over a wide area.

enemy_8008_eltswd.Description:
Cutting-edge tactical equipment designed by Rhodes Island's Engineering Department specifically for this round of Vector Breakout training.
While manifesting your emotions takes a toll, it offers strength in equal measure.
enemy_8008_eltswd.Name: V.T.E.

AbilityList.Text: Flying unit.
Can only be attacked while inside a Matrix.
Attacks deal AoE damage.
After two attacks, the next attack <$ba.stun>stuns</> all targets.

When defeated, leaves behind Supplies that will activate when Rosmontis, Simulated Sentry triggers [Cognitive Collapse]. Upon activation, allied units in a wide area will take reduced Physical and Arts damage.

enemy_8009_eltufo.Description:
A cutting-edge drone designed by Rhodes Island's Engineering Department specifically for this round of Vector Breakout training training.
Rosmontis loves its color.
enemy_8009_eltufo.Name: Rosmontis's Drone

AbilityList.Text: Takes greatly reduced Arts and Physical damage when force field is active; force field breaks when a large amount of damage is taken in a single instance

enemy_8012_mcnd.Description: Pith's student. Rational and good at math, with outstanding Originium Arts Assimilation. Chose to take to the battlefield as a defender operator to maintain an active mind.
enemy_8012_mcnd.Name: Document

AbilityList.Text: Unblockable
Accelerates when moving, <$ba.stun>stuns</> units along her path for a few seconds, and deals Physical damage based on her current Movement Speed
Temporarily gains a large <$ba.fragile>Fragile</> effect if movement is interrupted

enemy_8013_mcnrsh.Description: An orphan that Sharp brought to Rhodes Island. When in peak condition, she is fast enough to give Sharp a run for his money, and was thus recruited into his squad. Not happy with how Sharp often goes solo.
enemy_8013_mcnrsh.Name: Leafcarpet

AbilityList.Text: Periodically increases the ASPD and Movement Speed of all enemies on the field when not blocked

enemy_8014_mcnelp.Description: Touch's translator and a former Sami crook who decided to go straight and join Rhodes Island after being rescued by Touch. Claims to understand all the words that Touch leaves unsaid, which Touch neither affirms nor denies.
enemy_8014_mcnelp.Name: Stopwatch

AbilityList.Text: Takes greatly reduced Physical and Arts damage when unblocked, then fires a rain of arrows, dealing splash damage to units around the damage source and greatly reducing their ASPD
Rebirth

enemy_8015_mcnrhd.Description: Stormeye's drinking buddy who met him when he was still a wanderer, and later joined Rhodes Island together. She taught Stormeye how to hold his drink.
enemy_8015_mcnrhd.Name: Uproar

AbilityList.Text: First Form

[Suppression] Uses Haunting Flames to incapacitate one Operator on the field, causing them to be unable to act and take continuous Arts damage. If an Operator is defeated or retreats while affected by Haunting Flames, that Operator will be sealed, and cannot be redeployed until the Haunting Flames are destroyed.

[Payback] When HP drops to 0, all surrounding Operators will immediately be engulfed by Haunting Flames. Periodically releases <Condensed Heat> towards a friendly unit (if no eligible targets, this will be released towards the Objective Points instead).

[Condensed Heat] These flying flames released by Sverdsmeltr have low DEF and inflict continuous Arts and Burn to surrounding Operators. When they reach their target or the target leaves the field, they will self-destruct and deal Arts damage in a large area. Drains a Life Point upon reaching the Objective Point.

enemy_8001_flmlod.Description: From the youngest general of the Punishment Clan, to the final Diαblo. Facing the siege, he guarded the king's remains for three days and nights. Finally, in the final flame's light, he saw his promised homeland.
enemy_8001_flmlod.Name: Sverdsmeltr, Guardian Ember of the King

AbilityList.Text: First Form

[Suppression] Uses Haunting Flames to incapacitate one Operator on the field, causing them to be unable to act and take continuous Arts damage. If an Operator is defeated or retreats while affected by Haunting Flames, that Operator will be sealed, and cannot be redeployed until the Haunting Flames are destroyed.

[Payback] When HP drops to 0, all surrounding Operators will immediately be engulfed by Haunting Flames. Periodically releases <Condensed Heat> towards a friendly unit (if no eligible targets, this will be released towards the Objective Points instead).

[Condensed Heat] These flying flames released by Sverdsmeltr have low DEF and inflict continuous Arts and Burn to surrounding Operators. When they reach their target or the target leaves the field, they will self-destruct and deal Arts damage in a large area. Drains a Life Point upon reaching the Objective Point.
Second Form
Sverdsmeltr summons his Reforged Retinue and flies into the air.

When all Reforged Retinues are defeated or when Sverdsmeltr falls below 50% HP, Sverdsmeltr will absorb all remaining Reforged Retinues and restore HP. Afterward, he will land on the ground, where he deals long-ranged AoE Arts attacks and gains the following abilities:

[Extinction] Incapacitates one Operator on the field, causing them to be unable to act and releasing <Condensed Heat> at them. This <Condensed Heat> has higher HP and damage, and destroying it will allow the targeted Operator to resume acting.

enemy_8001_flmlod_2.Description: From the youngest general of the Punishment Clan, to the final Diαblo. Facing the siege, he guarded the king's remains for three days and nights. Finally, in the final flame's light, he saw his promised homeland.
enemy_8001_flmlod_2.Name: Sverdsmeltr, Guardian Ember of the King

AbilityList.Text: First Form

[Suppression] Uses Haunting Flames to incapacitate one Operator on the field, causing them to be unable to act and take continuous Arts damage. If an Operator is defeated or retreats while affected by Haunting Flames, that Operator will be sealed, and cannot be redeployed until the Haunting Flames are destroyed.

[Payback] When HP drops to 0, all surrounding Operators will immediately be engulfed by Haunting Flames. Periodically releases <Condensed Heat> towards a friendly unit (if no eligible targets, this will be released towards the Objective Points instead).

[Condensed Heat] These flying flames released by Sverdsmeltr have low DEF and inflict continuous Arts and Burn to surrounding Operators. When they reach their target or the target leaves the field, they will self-destruct and deal Arts damage in a large area. Drains a Life Point upon reaching the Objective Point.
Second Form
Sverdsmeltr summons his Reforged Retinue and flies into the air. During this period, he will periodically release <Condensed Heat> towards a friendly unit nearby.

When all Reforged Retinues are defeated or when Sverdsmeltr falls below 50% HP, Sverdsmeltr will absorb all remaining Reforged Retinues and restore HP. Afterward, he will land on the ground, where he deals long-ranged AoE Arts attacks and gains the following abilities:

[Extinction] Incapacitates one Operator on the field, causing them to be unable to act and releasing <Condensed Heat> at them. This <Condensed Heat> has higher HP and damage, and destroying it will allow the targeted Operator to resume acting.
[Sunwielder's Sanctuary] After using [Extinction], gains an Arts Barrier. While the Barrier persists, grants significantly increased DEF to self and deals Arts and Burn to surrounding allied units.

enemy_8001_flmlod_3.Description: From the youngest general of the Punishment Clan, to the final Diαblo. Facing the siege, he guarded the king's remains for three days and nights. Finally, in the final flame's light, he saw his promised homeland.
enemy_8001_flmlod_3.Name: Sverdsmeltr, Guardian Ember of the King

AbilityList.Text: [Mind Matrix] Takes less Physical and Arts damage. Loses this effect when the V.T.E. on the field is destroyed and cannot attack until the V.T.E. is re-obtained.
First Form

[Fling] Hurls a <V.T.E.> at an allied unit regardless of distance, dealing 3 instances of Physical damage to the target when it lands (The second and third instances are aftershocks, dealing half damage). <$ba.stun>Stunned</> targets are instantly defeated.
[Retrieve] Clears all Matrices on the field and retrieves all Tactical Equipment.

enemy_8007_eltrsm.Description:
A Breakthrough Trainer simulating Rosmontis at the peak of her combat prowess.
As she gazes at the 'walking arsenal' brought to life from data, her memories are finally liberated. Braver and more determined, she now yearns to fight alongside her companions.
enemy_8007_eltrsm.Name: Rosmontis, Simulated Sentry

AbilityList.Text: [Mind Matrix] Takes less Physical and Arts damage. Loses this effect when the V.T.E. on the field is destroyed and cannot attack until the V.T.E. is re-obtained.
First Form

[Fling] Hurls a <V.T.E.> at an allied unit regardless of distance, dealing 3 instances of Physical damage to the target when it lands (The second and third instances are aftershocks, dealing half damage). <$ba.stun>Stunned</> targets are instantly defeated.
[Retrieve] Clears all Matrices on the field and retrieves all Tactical Equipment.
[Impulse Inhibition] Initiates revival when HP reaches 0, periodically dealing Arts damage over a wide area around her every few seconds during the process.
Second Form
[Amplified Fling] Hurls a second <V.T.E.> a few seconds after the first. <$ba.stun>Stunned</> targets are instantly defeated.
[Memory Loss] Loses a certain amount of HP with every attack and deals Arts damage over a wide area around her.

enemy_8007_eltrsm_2.Description:
A Breakthrough Trainer simulating Rosmontis at the peak of her combat prowess.
As she gazes at the 'walking arsenal' brought to life from data, her memories are finally liberated. Braver and more determined, she now yearns to fight alongside her companions.
enemy_8007_eltrsm_2.Name: Rosmontis, Simulated Sentry

AbilityList.Text: [Mind Matrix] Takes less Physical and Arts damage. Loses this effect when the V.T.E. on the field is destroyed and cannot attack until the V.T.E. is re-obtained.
First Form

[Fling] Hurls a <V.T.E.> at an allied unit regardless of distance, dealing 3 instances of Physical damage to the target when it lands (The second and third instances are aftershocks, dealing half damage). <$ba.stun>Stunned</> targets are instantly defeated.
[Retrieve] Clears all Matrices on the field and retrieves all Tactical Equipment.
[Impulse Inhibition] Initiates revival when HP reaches 0, periodically dealing Arts damage over a wide area around her every few seconds during the process.
Second Form
[Amplified Fling] Hurls a second <V.T.E.> a few seconds after the first. <$ba.stun>Stunned</> targets are instantly defeated.
[Memory Loss] Loses a certain amount of HP with every attack and deals Arts damage over a wide area around her.
[Cognitive Collapse] Once HP drops below 50%, flies into the air and switches to ranged attacks. Increases ATK, no longer uses [Fling], and gains the following abilities:

Attacks <$ba.stun>stun</> the target for an extended period. [Mind Matrix] effect no longer expires and reduces damage taken even further. [Memory Loss] damage dealt and HP loss are both increased. When attacked, deals a certain amount of True damage to surrounding allies.

enemy_8007_eltrsm_3.Description:
A Breakthrough Trainer simulating Rosmontis at the peak of her combat prowess.
As she gazes at the 'walking arsenal' brought to life from data, her memories are finally liberated. Braver and more determined, she now yearns to fight alongside her companions.
enemy_8007_eltrsm_3.Name: Rosmontis, Simulated Sentry

AbilityList.Text: [Self-Defense Arts] Periodically gains a shield that protects against Physical and Arts damage, which is broken after taking a certain number of attacks
First Form
When HP is reduced to 0, if <Structural Principle> is alive on the field, summons drones to restore HP and revives when HP is at max

[Organically Linked Formula] Fights in concert with <Structural Principle>. When shield is broken or HP is reduced to 0, <Structural Principle> is <$ba.stun>stunned</>, and [Reactive Defense Module] is temporarily disabled.
[Concentration Algorithm] Locks onto a target and bombards it, dealing Physical damage to it and units in the 8 surrounding tiles several times

enemy_8010_mcnist.Description:
A Breakthrough Trainer simulating Mechanist at the peak of his combat prowess.
The engineer famous for his memory and scientific rigor can also write words as romantic as 'Love is like the second law of thermodynamics: the more one longs for eternity, the further one goes down the path of decline,' when he is drunk enough.
enemy_8010_mcnist.Name: Mechanist, Mechanical Mind

AbilityList.Text: [Self-Defense Arts] Periodically gains a shield that protects against Physical and Arts damage, which is broken after taking a certain number of attacks
First Form
When HP is reduced to 0, if <Structural Principle> is alive on the field, summons drones to restore HP and revives when HP is at max

[Organically Linked Formula] Fights in concert with <Structural Principle>. When shield is broken or HP is reduced to 0, <Structural Principle> is <$ba.stun>stunned</>, and [Reactive Defense Module] is temporarily disabled.
[Concentration Algorithm] Locks onto a target and bombards it, dealing Physical damage to it and units in the 8 surrounding tiles several times

When <Mechanist, Mechanical Mind> and <Structural Principle> are both waiting to be revived, activates [Nirvana Program]: Locks onto the target with the highest Block every few seconds and attacks them, reduces their Max Block, each attack dealing Arts damage to all your units on the same row or column with the target. Enters second form when program is terminated
Second Form

[Engineering Meteor Shower] Attacks the blocker continuously when <Structural Principle> is blocked, dealing Arts damage to all your units on the same row or column with the blocker, and temporarily reducing their Max Block

enemy_8010_mcnist_2.Description:
A Breakthrough Trainer simulating Mechanist at the peak of his combat prowess.
The engineer famous for his memory and scientific rigor can also write words as romantic as 'Love is like the second law of thermodynamics: the more one longs for eternity, the further one goes down the path of decline,' when he is drunk enough.
enemy_8010_mcnist_2.Name: Mechanist, Mechanical Mind

First Form
When HP is reduced to 0, if <Structural Principle> is alive on the field, summons drones to restore HP and revives when HP is at max

Enters second form when program is terminated
Second Form

Activates [Nirvana Program] again when HP drops below 50% for the first time

enemy_8010_mcnist_3.Description:
A Breakthrough Trainer simulating Mechanist at the peak of his combat prowess.
The engineer famous for his memory and scientific rigor can also write words as romantic as 'Love is like the second law of thermodynamics: the more one longs for eternity, the further one goes down the path of decline,' when he is drunk enough.
enemy_8010_mcnist_3.Name: Mechanist, Mechanical Mind

AbilityList.Text: When HP is reduced to 0, if <Mechanist, Mechanical Mind> is alive on the field, summons drones to restore HP and revives when HP is at max
First Form
[Reactive Defense Module] Gains increased DEF and RES when damage is taken; buff quickly degrades several seconds after the last damage is taken

[Focus Module] Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</> and continuously gains ASPD when attacking the same target (capped); resets when switching targets or not attacking for a few seconds

enemy_8011_mcndog.Description:
A risk assessment machine built by Mechanist. His best friend.
He set twenty defensive programs to prevent Closure from meddling with it.
enemy_8011_mcndog.Name: Structural Principle

AbilityList.Text: When HP is reduced to 0, if <Mechanist, Mechanical Mind> is alive on the field, summons drones to restore HP and revives when HP is at max
First Form
[Reactive Defense Module] Gains increased DEF and RES when damage is taken; buff quickly degrades several seconds after the last damage is taken

[Focus Module] Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion</> and continuously gains ASPD when attacking the same target (capped); resets when switching targets or not attacking for a few seconds
Second Form
[Acceleration Module] Gradually accelerates when moving, and deals additional damage on the first attack after being blocked based upon Movement Speed

enemy_8011_mcndog_2.Description:
A risk assessment machine built by Mechanist. His best friend.
He set twenty defensive programs to prevent Closure from meddling with it.
enemy_8011_mcndog_2.Name: Structural Principle

First Form

Second Form
